Ryanair denies claims that two Israeli F-16s almost collided with one of its Boeing 737s
Ryanair denies claims that two Israeli F-16s almost collided with one of its 
Boeing 737s
The Aviationist
March 5, 2016 Saturday 9:39 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 365 words
Byline: Dario Leone
Body
Mar 05, 2016( The Aviationist: http://theaviationist.com Delivered by Newstex)  On Mar. 1, 2016 two Israeli Air 
Force (IAF) F-16 Fighting Falcons[1] involved in a training exercise over the Negev desert[2] converged on the flight 
path of a Ryanair Boeing 737[3] on landing approach at Ovda airport[4] in Israel. 
Several media outlets claimed that the two IAF fighter jets came 'dangerously close' to the Ryanair aircraft, which 
had 162 passengers on board, and that a mid-air collision[5] was prevented only thanks to the airliner pilot who 
changed the course of his aircraft at the very last moment. But as reported by TimesofIsrael.com, Ryanair denied 
any claim of a near-miss. According to the airline, the flight from Krakow to Ovda was cruising at 27,000 ft in Israeli 
airspace[6] when the aircrew noticed two IAF F-16s climbing towards their flight path. As pointed out by a Ryanair 
statement, the two fighters remained at '3 miles away from the aircraft, so the reports of a 'nearly crash' or 'evasive 
manoeuvres' are all false and invented.' The airline also added that the Ryanair aircrew alerted the Air Traffic 
Control[7] which vectored the F-16s away from their Boeing 737. 'All passengers on board the Ryanair aircraft 
noticed nothing, since our aircraft never diverted from its cleared flight path to Ovda.' Although no injures or 
damages were reported, Israel's Transportation Ministry and the Israeli Air Force will investigate the matter. Image 
credit: Israeli Air Force Related articles [ 1]: http://theaviationist.com/2014/06/07/operation-opera-explained/ [ 2]:       
  
 
 
 
http://theaviationist.com/2014/09/15/f-15-lands-with-one-wing/ 
[ 
3]: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     
http://theaviationist.com/2015/08/20/crazy-video-shows-delta-boeing-737-hit-by-lightning-strike/ [ 4]:            
http://theaviationist.com/2015/10/30/blue-flag-2015-exercise-photos/ 
[ 
5]: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     
http://theaviationist.com/2015/11/16/how-two-fa-18s-brought-their-pilots-home-after-colliding-mid-air-during-air-
combat-training/ [ 6]:            http://theaviationist.com/2015/11/29/russian-intruding-israel-airspace-turkish-greek-one/ 
[ 7]:            http://theaviationist.com/2014/09/07/unresponsive-plane-escorted/

Body
Mar 03, 2016( The Legacy: http://www.localizedusa.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  American Century Companies 
Inc. decreased its position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 3.0% during the fourth quarter, 
according to its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 890,218 shares of the company's stock after 
selling 27,851 shares during the period. 
American Century Companies Inc. owned 0.34% of Ryanair Holdings plc worth $76,968,000 at the end of the most 
recent quarter.  A number of other large investors have also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. Adelphi 
Capital boosted its stake in Ryanair Holdings plc by 3.5% in the fourth quarter. Adelphi Capital now owns 132,371 
shares of the company's stock valued at $11,444,000 after buying an additional 4,455 shares during the last 
quarter. BB...ecurities boosted its stake in Ryanair Holdings plc by 1.6% in the fourth quarter. BB...ecurities now 
owns 11,630 shares of the company's stock valued at $1,005,000 after buying an additional 185 shares during the 
last quarter. Dorsey Wright ...sociates boosted its stake in Ryanair Holdings plc by 1.6% in the fourth quarter. 
Dorsey Wright ...sociates now owns 4,635 shares of the company's stock valued at $360,000 after buying an 
additional 75 shares during the last quarter. Korea Investment CORP boosted its stake in Ryanair Holdings plc by 
31.6% in the fourth quarter. Korea Investment CORP now owns 147,456 shares of the company's stock valued at 
$12,749,000 after buying an additional 35,434 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Regions Financial Corp 
boosted its stake in Ryanair Holdings plc by 7.0% in the fourth quarter. Regions Financial Corp now owns 29,804 
shares of the company's stock valued at $2,577,000 after buying an additional 1,948 shares during the last quarter.  
Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1]) opened at 83.83 on Thursday. The firm has a 50-day moving 
average price of $81.34 and a 200-day moving average price of $81.17. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12 month low 
of $64.08 and a 12 month high of $88.24. The stock has a market cap of $22.12 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio 
of 13.38.  Several brokerages have recently weighed in on RYAAY. Vetr[2] upgraded Ryanair Holdings plc from a 
'buy' rating to a 'strong-buy' rating and set a $90.63 target price on the stock in a report on Monday, November 
16th. Zacks Investment Research[3] raised shares of Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'hold' rating to a 'buy' rating and 
set a $95.00 price target on the stock in a research report on Monday, January 25th. One investment analyst has 
rated the stock with a sell rating, five have assigned a hold rating and nine have given a buy rating to the company's 
stock. Ryanair Holdings plc presently has an average rating of 'Buy' and an average price target of $87.00. Ryanair 
Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4]) is a holding company for Ryanair Limited (Ryanair). Ryanair operates a low fare, 
scheduled-passenger airline serving short-haul, point-to-point routes between Ireland, the United Kingdom, 
Continental Europe and Morocco.  Frustrated with your broker? Are you tired of paying high fees? Do you feel like

Ryanair pilot forced to make emergency landing in Berlin after groom and rowdy bachelor party cause chaos
Ryanair pilot forced to make emergency landing in Berlin after groom and 
rowdy bachelor party cause chaos
Deutsche Welle Europe
February 28, 2016 Sunday 2:57 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 279 words
Body
Feb 28, 2016( Deutsche Welle Europe: http://www.dw.de/top-stories/europe/s-1433 Delivered by Newstex)  A 
rowdy bachelor party on a flight to Bratislava has prompted a Ryanair pilot to make an unscheduled stop in Berlin, 
German police say. The men allegedly grew aggressive after the crew stopped serving them alcohol. 
The groom-to-be and five of his friends could face fines of up to 25,000 euros ($27,000), according to the police. 
The British nationals were "under the influence of alcohol" while flying from London to Bratislava for a bachelor 
party late Saturday, authorities said. They allegedly refused to stay in their seats, clashed with the cabin crew and 
started behaving aggressively after they were refused alcohol. One of the men reportedly took his clothes off. 
Eventually, the crew determined they "misbehaved so badly," that the pilot decided to divert the plane to Berlin's 
Schoenefeld airport.  Berlin police detained six of the alleged offenders, all aged between 25 and 28 and hailing 
from Southampton in southern England. Another six people from the same group were allowed to stay on board. 
"We will not tolerate unruly or disruptive behavior at any time and the safety and comfort of our customers, crew 
and aircraft is our number one priority," Ryanair said in a statement quoted by Southampton's Daily Echo. "This is 
now a matter for local police," the company added. After the stop in Berlin, the remaining 164 passengers were able 
to continue their flight to Bratislava. The British nationals were released after several hours. In addition to high fines, 
they could also be targeted with civil claims from the low-cost airline. dj/jlw (AFP, AP, dpa) 
Load-Date: February 28, 2016
End of Document

position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 408.9% during the fourth quarter, according to its most 
recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The institutional investor owned 690,664 shares of the company's stock after 
buying an additional 554,940 shares during the period. Russell Frank Co owned approximately 0.26% of Ryanair 
Holdings plc worth $60,060,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period. 
 A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also modified their holdings of RYAAY. 
BB...ecurities raised its position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 1.6% in the fourth quarter. BB...ecurities now 
owns 11,630 shares of the company's stock worth $1,005,000 after buying an additional 185 shares during the 
period. Ferguson Wellman Capital Management Inc. raised its position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 2.0% in 
the fourth quarter. Ferguson Wellman Capital Management Inc. now owns 71,362 shares of the company's stock 
worth $6,170,000 after buying an additional 1,389 shares during the period. Finally, Adelphi Capital raised its 
position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 3.5% in the fourth quarter. Adelphi Capital now owns 132,371 shares 
of the company's stock worth $11,444,000 after buying an additional 4,455 shares during the period.  Shares of 
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1]) opened at 83.39 on Friday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of 
$63.66 and a one year high of $88.24. The stock has a market cap of $22.00 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 
13.31. The company has a 50-day moving average price of $81.60 and a 200 day moving average price of $80.94.  
A number of analysts have weighed in on RYAAY shares. Zacks Investment Research[2] raised shares of Ryanair 
Holdings plc from a 'hold' rating to a 'buy' rating and set a $95.00 target price for the company in a research report 
on Monday, January 25th. Raymond James raised shares of Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'market perform' rating to 
an 'outperform' rating in a research report on Tuesday, November 3rd. Finally, Vetr[3] downgraded shares of 
Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'strong-buy' rating to a 'buy' rating and set a $83.00 target price for the company. in a 
research report on Wednesday, February 10th. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, five have issued a 
hold rating and nine have given a buy rating to the company. The company currently has a consensus rating of 
'Buy' and a consensus target price of $87.00. Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4]) is a holding company for 
Ryanair Limited (Ryanair). Ryanair operates a low fare, scheduled-passenger airline serving short-haul, point-to-
point routes between Ireland, the United Kingdom, Continental Europe and Morocco.  Frustrated with your broker?

Feb 22, 2016( The Legacy: http://www.localizedusa.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Sterling Investment Management 
Inc. lowered its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 20.0% during the fourth quarter, 
according to its most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The fund owned 
28,255 shares of the company's stock after selling 7,047 shares during the period. Ryanair Holdings plc makes up 
about 2.1% of Sterling Investment Management Inc.'s portfolio, making the stock its 19th largest position. 
Sterling Investment Management Inc.'s holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc were worth $2,443,000 as of its most 
recent filing with the SEC.  Other institutional investors have also recently made changes to their positions in the 
company. BB...ecurities raised its position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 1.6% in the fourth quarter. 
BB...ecurities now owns 11,630 shares of the company's stock valued at $1,005,000 after buying an additional 185 
shares in the last quarter. Ferguson Wellman Capital Management Inc. raised its position in shares of Ryanair 
Holdings plc by 2.0% in the fourth quarter. Ferguson Wellman Capital Management Inc. now owns 71,362 shares of 
the company's stock valued at $6,170,000 after buying an additional 1,389 shares in the last quarter. Finally, 
Adelphi Capital raised its position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 3.5% in the fourth quarter. Adelphi Capital 
now owns 132,371 shares of the company's stock valued at $11,444,000 after buying an additional 4,455 shares in 
the last quarter.  Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1]) opened at 84.69 on Monday. The firm has a 
market cap of $22.35 billion and a P/E ratio of 13.52. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $63.66 and a one 
year high of $88.24. The firm has a 50-day moving average price of $81.78 and a 200 day moving average price of 
$80.77.  Several equities analysts have recently commented on the company. Raymond James upgraded Ryanair 
Holdings plc from a 'market perform' rating to an 'outperform' rating in a research note on Tuesday, November 3rd. 
Zacks Investment Research[2] lowered Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research note 
on Friday, November 20th. Finally, Vetr[3] raised Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'strong-buy' rating and 
set a $90.63 price objective on the stock in a research report on Monday, November 16th. One research analyst 
has rated the stock with a sell rating, five have assigned a hold rating and nine have assigned a buy rating to the 
company's stock. The company has an average rating of 'Buy' and an average price target of $87.00. Ryanair 
Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4]) is a holding company for Ryanair Limited (Ryanair). Ryanair operates a low fare, 
scheduled-passenger airline serving short-haul, point-to-point routes between Ireland, the United Kingdom, 
Continental Europe and Morocco.  Frustrated with your broker? Are you tired of paying high fees? Do you feel like

Stocks Rally For 3rd Day In A Row; Tesla Surges
Stocks Rally For 3rd Day In A Row; Tesla Surges
Stock Market Today
February 17, 2016 Wednesday 10:08 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 456 words
Byline: NANCY GONDO
Body
Feb 17, 2016( Stock Market Today: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today/ Delivered by Newstex)  The 
stock market rallied again Wednesday to extend its winning streak for a third straight session, fueled by rising crude 
oil prices and upside earnings reports. The Nasdaq surged 2.2%, while the S...00 and Dow Jones industrial 
average each rose 1.6%. Volume was higher across the board, according to preliminary data, indicating conviction 
behind the buying. 
Stocks rose early and extended their gains throughout the session. Economic data were mixed, with January 
housing starts falling more than expected and producer prices rising above forecasts. Core PPI was the strongest 
since October 2014. WTI crude leapt 5% to more than $30 a barrel after Iran's oil minister said the country will 
support moves to help stabilize oil prices. On Tuesday, Saudi Arabia and Russia agreed to freeze output at January 
levels. Oil and gas stocks, online travel agents and automakers led the upside in Wednesday's stock market 
rally[1]. Chevron (CVX) led the Dow with a 4% jump. Also among energy plays, Kinder Morgan (KMI) gapped up 
and rose 10% after billionaire investor Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRKA) disclosed a 26 million share 
stake in the natgas transporter in Q4, according to an SEC filing. Priceline (PCLN) gapped up and soared 11%, 
leaping past its 50-day line and nearly retaking its 200-day line in speedy trade. Shares are now 16% below their 
52-week high. The online travel booker late Wednesday reported Q4 profit and revenue that topped views. Tesla 
(TSLA) cruised 9% higher for its fourth straight advance in above-average volume. The stock, at 41% off its 52-
week high, is still well below its 50-day and 200-day lines. Shares rose amid reports that SolarCity (SCTY) has 
selected the electric automaker to provide batteries to power a solar project it's working on for Kaua'i Island Utility 
Cooperative. SolarCity shares spiked 13% in robust trade. Tesla CEO Elon Musk is also chairman of the solar 
installer. Fortune magazine also reported an SEC filing showed Musk bought $10 million worth of SolarCity shares 
on Friday. On the IBD 40, NetEase (NTES), Ryanair Holdings (RYAAY) and Ellie Mae (ELLI) rallied, with respective 
gains of 4%, 5% and 6%, all in higher-than-usual turnover. Economic data slated for Thursday include the weekly 
jobless claims report, weekly petroleum inventory data and the Philly Fed business outlook survey for February. 
San Francisco Fed chief John Williams is also scheduled to speak. BJ's Restaurants (BJRI), MGM Resorts (MGM) 
and Waste Management (WM) are among companies reporting quarterly results Thursday. [ 1]: 
http://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/stock-market-today/ 
Load-Date: March 3, 2016

shares of Ryanair Holdings plc in a report on Wednesday, October 21st. Vetr[3] downgraded shares of Ryanair

Stocks End Down; Force Is Strong With Disney , But Shares Still Fall
Stocks End Down; Force Is Strong With Disney, But Shares Still Fall
Stock Market Today
February 10, 2016 Wednesday 12:17 AM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 614 words
Byline: NANCY GONDO
Body
Feb 09, 2016( Stock Market Today: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today/ Delivered by Newstex)  Stocks 
shook off steep early losses to wrap up a seesaw session with mild losses Tuesday, ahead of Walt Disney's (DIS) 
much anticipated earnings report. The Nasdaq composite dipped 0.3%, while the Dow Jones industrial average and 
S...00 each gave up just 0.1%. Volume was lighter across the board in the stock market today[1], according to 
preliminary figures. Losers topped winners by nearly 5-to-2 on the NYSE and 2-to-1 on the Nasdaq. 
After the close, Disney reported fiscal Q1 profit of $1.63 a share on $15.24 billion in revenue, above views for $1.45 
on $14.75 billion. The results got a boost from its studio division, which saw earnings jump 86% on strength from its 
blockbuster hit 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens.' Disney's theme parks unit's earnings rose 22%, but its TV 
networks, which includes ESPN, fell 6%. Shares initially rose after hours, but reversed to fall nearly 5%. The stock 
has declined since a November breakout from a cup-with-handle base failed. It's down 24% from its 52-week high. 
Energy stocks led the decline during the regular session, as West Texas Intermediate crude plunged 5% to $28.27 
a barrel. Chevron (CVX[2]) weighed on the Dow with an almost 4% drop, while Exxon Mobil (XOM[3]) slipped 
more than 1%. In the broader market, toy makers and steel stocks also posted big losses. Beverage, airline and 
other travel-related stocks outperformed. Ryanair Holdings (RYAAY[4]) soared almost 3%, regaining its 200-day 
line in average trade after spending two sessions below the support level. The stock is still well below its 50-day line 
and 13% off its high. Among other carriers, Hawaiian Holdings (HA[5]) added 5%, and Alaska Air Group (ALK[6]) 
improved by 4%. Spirit Airlines (SAVE[7]) rose 6%. Before the open, the Florida-based discount carrier reported Q4 
results[8] that topped views on both the top and bottom lines. Fuel costs dropped 38% to $1.59 per gallon. But total 
operating revenue per available seat mile fell 16% from a year earlier. The stock has rebounded 30% from its 
November lows but is still 49% off its 52-week high. TransDigm Group (TDG[9]), down 13% in massive volume, was 
the biggest loser on the IBD 50 after the aircraft components maker reported fiscal Q1 earnings that missed views. 
The stock fell sharply below the bottom of a flat base it had been carving since August. Notable companies 
reporting quarterly earnings Wednesday include Cisco Systems (CSCO), Expedia (EXPE), O'Reilly Automotive 
(ORLY), Tesla Motors (TSLA) and Twitter (TWTR). Economic data due out in the morning include weekly MBA 
mortgage applications, the weekly petroleum status report and the Treasury budget for January. Fed chief Janet 
Yellen 
and 
the 
San 
Francisco 
Fed's 
John 
Williams 
are 
also 
slated 
to 
speak.

U.S. Stocks Get Japan Rally Boost; Ryanair Buys Back Shares
U.S. Stocks Get Japan Rally Boost; Ryanair Buys Back Shares
Stock Market Today
February 9, 2016 Tuesday 10:25 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 274 words
Byline: KEN HOOVER
Body
Feb 01, 2016( Stock Market Today: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today/ Delivered by Newstex)  Stocks 
were lower, but well off their morning lows, as investors weighed falling oil prices against bullishness in Japan over 
negative interest rates. The Nasdaq fell 0.2%, while the S...00 and the Dow Jones industrial average dropped 0.3% 
each. 
Volume was tracking lower on both exchanges in the stock market today[1]. The Japanese Nikkei 225 index was up 
2% overnight, basking in the afterglow of Friday's decision by the Bank of Japan to use negative interest rates to 
help stimulate the country's stagnant economy. Nippon Telegraph ...lephone (NTT), the big Japanese telco, gapped 
up to trade nearly 3% higher. It's at its highest level in 15 years. Volume was running high on ADRs that trade on 
the NYSE. However, the Shanghai composite lost 2%, and European markets were trading moderately lower. West 
Texas Intermediate crude oil futures for March delivery were trading at $31.99 a barrel, a 5% plunge. Among IBD 
50 stocks, 31 were higher and 19 were lower. Facebook (FB) was among the top performers on the elite list, up 
more than 2% in volume that was well above average. It broke out of a base with a 110.75 buy point Friday in the 
wake of a better-than-expected earning report. As oil falls, airlines rise. Ryanair (RYAAY) was among the upside 
volume leaders with a nearly 4% gain. The Irish airline announced it is doubling its stock buyback program to 800 
million euros ($870 million) in spite of weak sales in the aftermath of the Paris terrorist attack. [ 1]: 
http://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/stock-market-today/

Stock Market Sinks With Oil, But Airlines Soar
Stock Market Sinks With Oil, But Airlines Soar
Stock Market Today
February 9, 2016 Tuesday 10:25 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 398 words
Byline: NANCY GONDO
Body
Feb 01, 2016( Stock Market Today: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today/ Delivered by Newstex)  Stocks 
stayed firmly in the red in early afternoon trading Monday as oil prices, economic data and China's market 
continued to weigh. The S...00 and Dow Jones industrial average were each down 0.6%, while the Nasdaq fell 
0.5%. Volume was lighter across the board vs. 
the same time Friday. Losers topped winners by 2-to-1 on the NYSE and nearly a 3-2 margin on the Nasdaq. Oil 
stocks led the decline as West Texas intermediate crude prices sank 6% to below $32 a barrel. Steel and toy maker 
stocks were also down hard. Mattel (MAT) fell 5% in heavy trade ahead of its Q4 earnings report due after the 
close. The stock is shaping the handle of a cup-with-handle base with a 30.54 buy point, but is still 47% off its May 
2013 peak. Analysts expect the Barbie and Hot Wheels maker to earn 61 cents a share on $1.91 billion in revenue. 
Mattel on Thursday said its Barbie Dolls will be available in three new body types: curvy, petite and tall, as well as a 
variety of skin tones, eye colors and hairstyles. Online travel bookers, airlines and automakers outperformed. 
Ryanair Holdings (RYAAY) gapped up and soared 4% in fast turnover as it tried to regain its 50-day moving 
average. The stock may be forming a new base. It triggered the 8% loss sell rule last week after falling below an 
85.66 flat-base buy point. The Irish discount carrier said its fiscal Q3 profit doubled and announced a stock buyback 
of 800 million euros ($870 million). Jetblue Airways (JBLU) lifted 3% in above-average volume as shares continue 
to trade below their conjoined 200-day and 50-day lines. The stock carried its momentum from Friday, when it rose 
7% after the airline reported Q4 earnings and revenue that topped views. Barclays on Monday cut its price target to 
29 from 32 amid concerns related to the Zika virus. Alphabet (GOOGL) climbed 1% in rapid trade ahead of its Q4 
report, also due after the close. Analysts expect the Internet giant's EPS to rise 18% to $8.10 on 15% higher 
revenue to $20.77 billion. Shares are extended past a 713.43 buy point cleared Oct. 23. On the IBD 50, Facebook 
(FB) added 2% to a new high, on track to extend its win streak for a third straight session since Thursday, when the 
stock vaulted 16% on a big Q4 beat. Shares are near the top of a buy range from a 110.75 entry.

reversed off morning lows, but still held losses going into the noon hour Tuesday. The Nasdaq and the S...00 were 
down 0.4% each while the Dow Jones industrial average fell 0.5%. Volume was tracking lower than the same time 
Monday in the stock market today[1]. Traders hoping to snag a bottom boosted the price of West Texas 
intermediate futures for March delivery 0.4% to $29.82 a barrel, despite a report from the Energy Information 
Administration that stockpiles were growing. 
Amazon (AMZN) was off 1%. A Bloomberg report said the company is planning a global delivery service to compete 
against FedEx (FDX), United Parcel (UPS) and Alibaba (BABA). The service would seek to control the flow of 
goods from factories in China and India to customers in U.S. and European cities. The service, to be called Global 
Supply Chain by Amazon, could start up as soon as this year. Facebook (FB) and Alphabet (GOOGL), which have 
had multiday sell-offs, rose nearly 2% as they struggled to recover. IBD 50 stocks were roughly evenly divided 
between gainers and decliners. The best performer on the elite list was Ryanair (RYAAY), up nearly 4% as it sought 
to recover its 200-day moving average. The worst performer was Scripps Network Interactive (SNI), down nearly 
6% as it lost its 50-day line. The company operates HGTV, the DIY Network along with the Food, Cooking and 
Travel channels. [ 1]: http://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/stock-market-today/

across the board in the stock market today[1], according to preliminary figures. 
Losers led winners by a nearly 5-2 margin on the NYSE and by 2-to-1 on the Nasdaq. Energy stocks led the 
decline, as West Texas Intermediate crude plunged 5% to $28.27 a barrel. Chevron (CVX) weighed on the Dow 
with an almost 4% drop, while Exxon Mobil (XOM) slipped more than 1%. In the broader market, toy makers and 
steel stocks also posted big losses. Beverage, airline and other travel-related stocks outperformed. Ryanair 
Holdings (RYAAY) soared almost 3%, regaining its 200-day line in average trade after spending two sessions below 
the support level. The stock is still well below its 50-day line and 13% off its high. Among other carriers, Spirit 
Airlines (SAVE) rose 6%, Hawaiian Holdings (HA) added 5%, and Alaska Air Group (ALK) improved by 4%. Before 
the open, Spirit Airlines reported Q4 results[2] that topped views on both the top and bottom lines. The Florida-
based discount airline's fuel costs dropped 38% to $1.59 per gallon. But total operating revenue per available seat 
mile fell 16% from a year earlier. The stock has rebounded 30% from its November lows but is still 49% off its 52-
week high. TransDigm Group (TDG), down 13% in massive volume, was the biggest loser on the IBD 50 after the 
aircraft components maker reported fiscal Q1 earnings that missed views. The stock fell sharply below the bottom 
of a flat base it had been carving since August. All eyes were on Disney (DIS), which finished the regular session 
with a 0.2% gain after falling as much as 3% intraday. The media giant reported fiscal Q1 earnings after the close 
which beat estimates, but shares were down after hours. [ 1]: http://www.investors.com/category/market-

share buyback, citing 'rising profitability and improving cash flow.' Chipotle (CMG) jumped nearly 3% after the 
Centers for Disease Control concluded its investigation of an E. coli outbreak at Chipotle restaurants without 
determining the source of the contamination. Bank of America Merrill Lynch upgraded Chipotle shares to 
outperform from neutral. In M...ews, Abbott Laboratories (ABT) added 1% on word that it is acquiring diagnostic-test 
company Alere (ALR) for $5.8 billion. Alere shot up 45%. Inside the IBD 50, Argentina bank Grupo Financiero 
Galicia (GGAL) added close to 1% after rising 5% last week. It's working on a base with a 29.35 buy point. Alphabet

Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) PT at $88.91
Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) PT at $88.91
The Legacy
January 28, 2016 Thursday 11:21 AM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 864 words
Byline: mitch
Body
Jan 28, 2016( The Legacy: http://www.localizedusa.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) has been assigned an average recommendation of 'Buy' from the fifteen analysts that are 
covering the company, MarketBeat Ratings reports[1]. One research analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, 
five have issued a hold rating, eight have issued a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating on the 
company. The average twelve-month price objective among brokerages that have updated their coverage on the 
stock in the last year is $88.91.  Other hedge funds have modified their holdings of the company. BB...ecurities 
increased its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 1.6% in the fourth quarter. BB...ecurities now owns 11,630 
shares of the company's stock worth $1,005,000 after buying an additional 185 shares during the last quarter. 1st 
Global Advisors Inc. increased its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 8.9% in the fourth quarter. 1st Global 
Advisors Inc. now owns 3,132 shares of the company's stock worth $271,000 after buying an additional 257 shares 
during the last quarter. Adelphi Capital increased its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 3.5% in the fourth 
quarter. Adelphi Capital now owns 132,371 shares of the company's stock worth $11,444,000 after buying an 
additional 4,455 shares during the last quarter. CIBC World Markets increased its stake in shares of Ryanair 
Holdings plc by 209.9% in the fourth quarter. CIBC World Markets now owns 7,890 shares of the company's stock 
worth $682,000 after buying an additional 5,344 shares during the last quarter. Finally, UMB Bank acquired a new 
stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc during the fourth quarter worth $535,000.  A number of brokerages have 
recently commented on RYAAY. Beaufort Securities reiterated a 'buy' rating on shares of Ryanair Holdings plc in a 
research note on Tuesday, October 6th. HSBC cut Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a 
research note on Friday, October 2nd. TheStreet reiterated a 'buy' rating on shares of Ryanair Holdings plc in a 
research note on Wednesday, October 21st. Vetr[2] upgraded Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'strong-
buy' rating and set a $90.63 price target for the company in a research note on Monday, November 16th. Finally, 
Zacks Investment Research[3] cut Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research note on 
Friday, November 20th. Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4]) opened at 79.72 on Monday. The firm's 50-day 
moving average price is $84.49 and its 200 day moving average price is $80.30. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-
month low of $62.53 and a 12-month high of $88.24. The company has a market capitalization of $21.03 billion and 
a price-to-earnings ratio of 13.43.  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on 
Monday, November 2nd. The company reported $0.99 earnings per share for the quarter, missing the consensus 
estimate of $3.30 by $2.31. On average, analysts expect that Ryanair Holdings plc will post $5.16 earnings per 
share for the current year.  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[5]) is a holding company for Ryanair Limited 
(Ryanair). Ryanair operates a low fare, scheduled-passenger airline serving short-haul, point-to-point routes 
between Ireland, the United Kingdom, Continental Europe and Morocco. The Company's principal fleet consists of 
Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) PT at $88.91
Boeing 737-800 aircraft, each having 189 seats. The Company offered over 1,600 short-haul flights per day serving 
approximately 190 airports across Europe, and flying approximately 1,600 routes, with a fleet of approximately 315 
Boeing 737-800 aircraft and six additional leased aircraft acquired on short term leases. Ryanair's fleet totaled to 
308 Boeing 737-800s. Ryanair also provides various ancillary services and engages in other activities connected 
with its air passenger service, including non-flight scheduled services, Internet-related services, and the in-flight 
sale of beverages, food and merchandise. This story was originally published by Corvus Business Newswire (

Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Stake Increased by Adelphi Capital
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Stake Increased by Adelphi Capital
The Legacy
January 25, 2016 Monday 6:49 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 863 words
Byline: Rick
Body
Jan 25, 2016( The Legacy: http://www.localizedusa.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Adelphi Capital boosted its 
position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 3.5% during the fourth quarter, according to its most recent 
filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The institutional investor owned 132,371 shares of the 
company's stock after buying an additional 4,455 shares during the period. Ryanair Holdings plc accounts for 6.5% 
of Adelphi Capital's investment portfolio, making the stock its 2nd largest position. Adelphi Capital's holdings in 
Ryanair Holdings plc were worth $11,444,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  Several other institutional investors 
also recently made changes to their positions in the stock. BB...ecurities raised its position in shares of Ryanair 
Holdings plc by 1.6% in the fourth quarter. BB...ecurities now owns 11,630 shares of the company's stock worth 
$1,005,000 after buying an additional 185 shares during the period. CIBC World Markets increased its position in 
shares of Ryanair Holdings plc by 209.9% in the fourth quarter. CIBC World Markets now owns 7,890 shares of the 
company's stock worth $682,000 after buying an additional 5,344 shares in the last quarter. Finally, UMB Bank 
acquired a new position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc during the fourth quarter worth approximately $535,000.  
Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1]) traded down 2.15% on Monday, reaching $80.90. 393,650 
shares of the company's stock traded hands. The firm has a market capitalization of $21.35 billion and a P/E ratio of 
13.55. The company's 50-day moving average is $84.60 and its 200-day moving average is $80.10. Ryanair 
Holdings plc has a 52 week low of $62.53 and a 52 week high of $88.24.  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 2nd. The company reported $0.99 EPS for the 
quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of $3.30 by $2.31. Equities research analysts anticipate that 
Ryanair Holdings plc will post $5.16 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  RYAAY has been the topic of a 
number of research reports. HSBC downgraded shares of Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating 
in a research note on Friday, October 2nd. Vetr[2] raised shares of Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 
'strong-buy' rating and set a $90.63 target price on the stock in a research note on Monday, November 16th. 
Beaufort Securities reissued a 'buy' rating on shares of Ryanair Holdings plc in a research note on Tuesday, 
October 6th. Zacks Investment Research[3] raised shares of Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'hold' rating to a 'buy' 
rating and set a $95.00 price target on the stock in a research note on Monday. Finally, Raymond James raised 
shares of Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'market perform' rating to an 'outperform' rating in a research note on 
Tuesday, November 3rd. One equities research analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, five have given a hold 
rating, eight have given a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the company's stock. The stock 
currently has a consensus rating of 'Buy' and an average price target of $88.91. Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[4]) is a holding company for Ryanair Limited (Ryanair). Ryanair operates a low fare, scheduled-
passenger airline serving short-haul, point-to-point routes between Ireland, the United Kingdom, Continental Europe 
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Stake Increased by Adelphi Capital

aircraft acquired on short term leases. Ryanair's fleet totaled to 308 Boeing 737-800s. Ryanair also provides

Google sidelined 780 million suspect ads in 2015
Google sidelined 780 million suspect ads in 2015
Phys.org - Science and Technology News
January 22, 2016 Friday 2:51 AM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 476 words
Body
Jan 21, 2016( Phys.org - Science and Technology News: http://phys.org/ Delivered by Newstex)  Google revealed 
on Thursday that it sidelined more than 780 million ads deemed rude, dishonest or dangerous in 2015 in a leap 
from the 524 million targeted a year earlier. "Some ads[1] are just plain bad—like ads that carry malware, cover up 
content you're trying to see, or promote fake goods," Google senior vice president of ads and commerce Sridhar 
Ramaswamy said in a blog post. 
"Bad ads can ruin your entire online experience, a problem we take very seriously." Google has a team of more 
than 1,000 people around the world devoted to fighting "bad ads," and has armed them with sophisticated 
technology, according to Ramaswamy. Google disables ads for violating the California-based Internet giant's 
policies. More than 10,000 websites and 18,000 accounts were suspended for hawking counterfeit goods such as 
designer watch knock-offs, and Google blocked more than 12.5 million healthcare-related ads that included offering 
drugs that were approved for use or made claims that weren't properly supported. Weight-loss scams were among 
top complaints by Google users last year, and the company responded by suspending more than 30,000 websites 
for making misleading claims, Ramaswamy said. Google also blocked nearly 7,000 "phishing" websites crafted to 
looked like online pages of legitimate businesses such as banks but intended to trick people into entering 
passwords or other personal information. "We got even tougher on ads that mislead or trick people into interacting 
with them—like ads designed to look like system warnings from your computer," Ramaswamy said. "In 2015 alone 
we rejected more than 17 million." Google vowed to ramp the war on bad online ads this year along. It also said it 
will increase defenses against malicious software and computer networks known as "bots" programmed to 
automatically click online ads to drive up revenue from pay-per-click marketing messages. Relevant stories Google 
gives Gmail a new look[2] Google reshuffles placement of online search ads[3] Google to change terms to use your 
identity in ads[4] Google to shield students from digital ads[5] Google looks for more revenue from ads in Android 
app store[6] Ryanair launches court action against Google, eDreams[7] [ 1]: http://phys.org/tags/ads/ [ 2]:            
http://phys.org/news/2011-11-google-gmail.html#nRlv [ 3]:            http://phys.org/news/2011-11-google-reshuffles-
placement-online-ads.html#nRlv [ 4]:            http://phys.org/news/2013-10-google-terms-identity-ads.html#nRlv [ 5]:       
  
 
 
 
http://phys.org/news/2014-04-google-shield-students-digital-ads.html#nRlv 
[ 
6]: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     
http://phys.org/news/2015-02-google-revenue-ads-android-app.html#nRlv [ 7]:            http://phys.org/news/2015-12-
ryanair-court-action-google-edreams.html#nRlv 
Load-Date: February 28, 2016

J.B. Hunt (JBHT) Beats on Q4 Earnings, Misses Revenues
J.B. Hunt (JBHT) Beats on Q4 Earnings, Misses Revenues
Zacks Investment Research
January 21, 2016 Thursday 4:36 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 697 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Jan 21, 2016( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  J.B. Hunt Transport 
Services Inc. JBHT[1] reported mixed fourth-quarter 2015 financial results wherein the bottom line surpassed the 
Zacks Consensus Estimate while the top line missed.This transportation company's earnings came in at $1.01 per 
share, a penny higher than the Zacks Consensus Estimate. Earnings were also up 8.60% on a year-over-year 
basis.Total operating revenue increased 0.71% year over year to $1,621 million but missed the Zacks Consensus 
Estimate of $1,623 million. 
Operating income in the quarter improved 5.46% year over year to $192.83 million.The Intermodal (JBI) division 
reported quarterly revenues of $967.13 million, up 0.98% year over year. Segmental results were hurt by the 
lingering effects of disruptive shipping patterns following the West Coast port disturbances. Slow rail service 
recovery and soft consumer driven freight demand also impeded load volume growth. Meanwhile, operating income 
decreased 0.8% year over year to $127.73 million.Dedicated Contract Services (DCS) revenues grew 1.66% year 
over year to $369 million in the reported quarter on higher number of revenue-generating trucks. The average truck 
count stood at 7,208, up 4.77%. Operating income increased 13.42% year over year to $42 million.Integrated 
Capacity Solutions (ICS) revenues fell 4% year over year to $189.54 million. On a year-over-year basis, revenue 
per load fell 30.62% primarily due to lower fuel prices and weak transactional customer demand. Operating income 
surged 40.28% year over year to $12.75 million.Truck (JBT) revenues inched up 3.1% year over year to $99.29 
million. At the end of the reported quarter, the company operated 2,149 tractors, up 13.94% year over year. 
Operating income improved 28.92% to $10.4 million.LiquidityAt the end of the reported quarter, cash and cash 
equivalents were $5,566 million compared with approximately $5,961 million at 2014-end. Long-term debt stood at 
$1,005 million compared with $683.54 million at the end of 2014.Zanks Rank ...y PicksJ.B. Hunt currently carries a 
Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Better-ranked stocks in the same space are United Continental Holdings, Inc. UAL[2], Spirit 
Airlines, Inc. SAVE[3] and Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[4]. All the three stocks hold a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).Want 
the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the 
Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report >>[5]Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research?

How Long Does Granny Have, Doctor?
How Long Does Granny Have, Doctor?
Pallimed
January 20, 2016 Wednesday 6:38 AM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 781 words
Byline: Niamh van Meines
Body
Jan 20, 2016( Pallimed: http://www.pallimed.org/ Delivered by Newstex)             http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-
g2dg9zHZQLs/Vp8HZrSr4yI/AAAAAAABEAs/c2PesXZk21U/s1600/Time_clock_at_wookey_hole_cave_museum.J
PGby Liam Farrell 'How long does granny have, doctor?' 'Only a few days,' I said. I was young and beautiful and 
too green to know that the wise clinician always fudges the prognosis. 
Within minutes the message was winging its way across the globe. A few nights later and there were relatives 
tucked in every corner, swinging on the rafters, hanging from the roof, dangling from the curtains. Not that granny 
was an angel. To paraphrase Jonathan Swift: true to her profit and her pride, she made them weep before she died. 
But as La Rochefoucauld observed, we are more often loved for our vices than our virtues, and the relatives had 
ridden in on the four winds, swum dangerous rivers, climbed huge mountains, endured biting insects and even 
Ryanair flights. They'd come from Boston, Singapore, Sydney, Vladivostok, all determined to be there at granny's 
deathbed. So I was disconcerted to find granny looking much better, quite perky even. Breaking bad news is all part 
of the job, but breaking good news was a novel challenge. I'd parked my car on a downhill slope, facing away from 
the cottage, to facilitate a quick getaway. If it proved a long pursuit, had I enough petrol, I wondered. 'I have good 
news,' I said, trying gamely to give it a positive spin, 'Your granny's not dying after all. She's looking much better. 
Ain't that great?' There was an ominous silence, which, inexperienced as I was, I felt compelled to fill. 'Underneath it 
all, she has a great engine, heart like a lion, strong as a horse, and all,' I continued, starting to babble, hoping that 
this testament to the clan's animal virility might soften the blow. 'We were told she was very ill,' accused Boston. A 
rebellious muttering began. 'It's cost me a bloody fortune,' from the deserts of Sudan. 'My return flight is next 
weekend,' from the gardens of Japan. 'I've taken a week off work for this,' from Milan. 'I knew there was bugger all 
wrong with her,' from Yucatan. The crowd shifted threateningly forward, as crowds do when someone has a rope, a 
nearby tree has a convenient low branch, and the gestalt has a lynching in mind. 'Don't lose hope,' I said, 'I've 
adopted the Liverpool Care Pathway.'Dr Liam Farrell (@drlfarrell[1]) has been a columnist for many years, for the 
BMJ and Lancet among others. He was a family doctor for 20 years in Crossmaglen, Ireland, and is a former tutor 
in 
palliative 
care. 
Follow 
his Facebook[2] page. 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/212450/Liverpool_Care_Pathway.pdf

Care Pathway: More Care, Less Pathway: A review of The Liverpool Care Pathway[4] Leadership Alliance for the

get more palliative care than elderly multi-disease patients? Why is that?Topic 2: What do patients and families

expect of prognosis, especially close to death?Topic 3: How can we help patients and families prepare for 
death?What: #hpm chat on Twitter When: Wed 1/20/2016 - 9p ET/ 6p PT Host: Dr Liam Farrell @drlfarrell[6]Please 
follow @hpmchat[7] and check hpmchat.org[8] for more details. You can access the transcripts and analytics of

European airlines form alliance amid fierce competition
European airlines form alliance amid fierce competition
Deutsche Welle Business
January 20, 2016 Wednesday 8:10 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 273 words
Body
Jan 20, 2016( Deutsche Welle Business: http://www.dw-world.de/ Delivered by Newstex)  Europe's largest airline 
groups have launched a new alliance in a bid to become stronger in the face of more competition from Gulf rivals. 
Among other things, the association wants to fight rising airport charges. Europe's five largest airline groups on 
Wednesday called into being a new alliance meant to boost the carriers' clout in talks and negotiation with officials 
and policymakers. Dubbed Airlines for Europe (A4E), the alliance brings together budget carriers such as Easyjet 
and Ryanair with the sector's giants, including Lufthansa, Air France-KLM and the International Airline Group (IAG), 
the parent company of both British Airways and Iberia. "The alliance will represent the interests of its members 
when dealing with the EU institutions, international organizations and national governments on European aviation 
issues," it said in a statement at the launch at Amsterdam's Schiphol airport.  Rough deal for travelers? The alliance 
called for swift steps to stop European travelers "being fleeced by excessive airport charges." Citing a recent study, 
it revealed that airport charges at the 21 largest European aviation hubs had soared by 80 percent since 2005. The 
alliance said it also intended to push for a more reliable airspace by reducing the costs of air traffic control through 
the completion of the Single European Sky scheme. Launched in the late 1990s, the aim of the project is to make 
European skies more competitive, secure and environmentally friendly by eliminating national borders in control 
systems. hg/jd (AFP, Reuters)

Delta saved $5.1 billion last year as gas prices plummeted
Delta saved $5.1 billion last year as gas prices plummeted
BusinessPundit
January 19, 2016 Tuesday 3:42 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 288 words
Byline: Tammy Johnson
Body
Jan 19, 2016( BusinessPundit: http://www.businesspundit.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Delta saved $5.1 billion on 
fuel last year as oil prices plummeted. The company in return posted an annual profit of $4.5 billion in 2015. 
The airline also revealed that it hopes to save another $3 billion in 2016 as a result of lower energy prices. 
While lowering fuel prices helped the airline, officials say sales were off by 2% as a strong US dollar played against 
international tourism to the United States. Its quarterly profits were also lower than expected. Delta isn't expecting 
much improvement in the first quarter either. It said that passenger unit revenue will be down 2.5% to 4.5% from a 
year ago — caused mostly by currently fluctuations. Flights in Europe, Asia and Latin America account for nearly 
30% of Delta's passenger revenue. The airline says it expects profit margins to improve in the quarter. Its stock was 
up more than 3% in early trading Tuesday. Despite lower fuel prices, shares at Delta are down 12% in 2016. Other 
airlines with declining stock include United, American, Southwest, JetBlue, and others. Delta has reported that miles 
flown rose 3% in the fourth quarter. Load factor, which measures the overall number of people on a flight hit 85.2%, 
up from 82.8% a year ago. Delta and many of its premiere competitors have also been pressured to lower prices as 
airlines such as Southwest and RyanAir continue to attract bargain shoppers for domestic flights. The post Delta 
saved $5.1 billion last year as gas prices plummeted[1] appeared first on Business Pundit[2]. [ 1]: 
http://www.businesspundit.com/delta-saved-5-1-billion-last-year-as-gas-prices-plummeted/ [ 2]:            
http://www.businesspundit.com

The Idea of Low Cost Carriers Connecting with Legacy Carriers Is Not New, But It Is for Ryanair and easyJet
The Idea of Low Cost Carriers Connecting with Legacy Carriers Is Not New, 
But It Is for Ryanair and easyJet
The Cranky Flier
January 14, 2016 Thursday 12:31 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 962 words
Byline: CF
Body
Jan 14, 2016( The Cranky Flier: http://www.crankyflier.com Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> This week, the Financial 
Times looked at the purportedly novel idea that Ryanair and easyJet may try to cooperate with legacy carriers to 
transfer passengers[1]. This would be news for those two airlines, but it's not a surprise. While it's certainly not 
something without precedent, this plan is a little different. It's going to be much harder to make this work.<nl/>
<nl/>The article talks about how both easyJet and Ryanair are interested in bringing people to gateway cities and 
then transferring them to traditional long haul carriers. In other words, they're looking for an interline agreement, but 
with a twist (which we'll get into later). That these airlines are exploring this possibility is not surprising at all 
considering where they are in their histories.<nl/> When new airlines start, most fail in a short period of time. But 
when an airline finds a niche that works, it looks to grow quickly. Not only does growth help to keep unit costs lower 
(constantly adding new, entry level wages) but it also helps to compete with other airlines that might try to serve the 
same niche. During this phase of life, the goal is to just keep growing and keep costs low. It's a beautiful thing.<nl/> 
Eventually, however, airlines start looking for other avenues to keep growth rates up. They start to realize that 
having the lowest costs won't necessarily matter if they can increase revenue more than they increase costs. While 
low cost carriers traditionally don't like the idea of partnering with other airlines because of the costs involved, the 
older they get, the more benefit they see.<nl/> In the US, take a look at JetBlue in New York and Boston. Look at 
Virgin America in San Francisco and LA. And though it's a slightly different model, look at Alaska in Seattle and 
Hawaiian in Honolulu. All of these airlines share something unique. They have strong positions in major 
international gateways, and they can provide feed to a variety of airlines without adding too much cost. The revenue 
benefit is well worth it.<nl/> The situation with Ryanair and easyJet is somewhat different. Yes, they're ultra low cost 
carriers but that's not what's different. They're ultra low cost carriers that have been around a lot longer than their 
counterparts in the US so they're further along in their life cycle.<nl/> What's different is that JetBlue and Virgin 
America focus their partnering efforts on carriers abroad. Those foreign carriers can't fly domestically within the US, 
so it makes sense for them to tap into the networks of US-based airlines.<nl/> What easyJet and Ryanair are 
talking about is partnering with airlines in their own backyard. So instead of feeding American or United for their 
flights across the Pond, Ryanair and easyJet want to put people on Lufthansa, British Airways, etc.<nl/> If this 
sounds crazy, it probably is for several reasons.<nl/> 1) These airlines would have a hard time feeding each other 
considering their networks don't overlap all that much. BA's hub is Heathrow, yet there are no low cost carriers at 
Heathrow. Frankfurt? You won't see Ryanair or easyJet there. Paris/Charles de Gaulle? easyJet does fly there but 
Ryanair doesn't. This isn't necessarily for lack of trying. If low cost carriers could get slots at Heathrow, they'd be 
The Idea of Low Cost Carriers Connecting with Legacy Carriers Is Not New, But It Is for Ryanair and easyJet
there. And that could be part of the reason these airlines want to work with legacy carriers. It might help crack open 
the door.<nl/> 2) Labor would lose their minds. When JetBlue feeds an Aer Lingus flight, it's not pushing away 
passengers it would carry on its own (or vice versa). But if Ryanair puts people on British Airways, those could very 
well be people that BA could carry itself. Should BA be carrying those passengers? We can debate that, but I can 
guarantee where labor would land on that topic.<nl/> The idea, of course, is that legacy carriers could reduce their 
short haul operations and farm it out to more efficient airlines. But labor would go scorched earth if that were to 
happen. (You've seen them go nuts for much less, just look at every other week at Lufthansa and Air France.)<nl/> 
3) While the idea of interlining is great, it sounds like Ryanair wants to take absolutely no responsibility or bear any 
costs. (That's the 'twist' I was talking about.) According to the FT article, Ryanair refuses to have to deal with what 
happens if it delivers a passenger late and that person misses a connection. The way Ryanair sees it would be 
almost like an old regional airline prorate deal.<nl/> You wouldn't buy a Ryanair ticket at all. You'd buy a ticket on 
the big long haul airline and it would just include a flight on Ryanair with it. But if anything goes wrong that long haul 
airline would have to deal with it.<nl/> That arrangement seems sweet for Ryanair. The airline gets more 
passengers and has nothing else to worry about. But were I Air France, I don't think I'd be too thrilled.<nl/> I tend to 
think the best way to structure this is how GatwickConnects[2] has done it. That's a fantastic way to let the airport 
create the business of connecting airlines that don't work together. More airports should take that lead.<nl/> But a 
relationship like the one that's been envisioned in the FT article? There are a lot of hurdles to overcome.<nl/> 
[Original trenchcoat photo[3] via Shutterstock]<nl/> [ 1]: http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/2/2d2e6ec0-b39e-11e5-b147-
e5e5bba42e51.html [ 2]:            http://crankyflier.com/2015/09/24/the-innovative-gatwickconnects-allows-you-to-
connect-between-airlines-that-dont-work-together-without-the-risk/ [ 3]:            http://www.shutterstock.com/pic-
212286157/stock-photo-angry-couple-fighting-in-trench-coats-on-white-background.html 
Load-Date: January 15, 2016
End of Document
For just $199, this budget airline will fly you from California to almost anywhere in Europe
For just $199, this budget airline will fly you from California to almost 
anywhere in Europe
The Business Insider
January 13, 2016 Wednesday 10:56 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 703 words
Byline: Raisa Bruner
Body
Jan 13, 2016( The Business Insider: http://www.businessinsider.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Courtesy of 
WOW Air<nl/>This week, Icelandic budget airline WOW Air unveiled a set of new flight deals from Los Angeles 
International Airport and San Francisco International Airport: $199 one-way tickets to various destinations in 
Europe, and $99 straight to Iceland.<nl/>
 Yes, you read those numbers right.<nl/> The $199 flights have a one-hour stopover in Keflavik, Iceland, before 
allowing you to jump to 18 different cities in Europe, including London, Paris, and Berlin.<nl/> For a long-haul 
transatlantic commute, that's a steal; a quick online price check with traditional carriers shows nonstop flights for 
later this month going for $1,200 and up, and one-stop options hovering in the $700 range. With more than two 
stops on your route, you're still going to have to shell out $518.<nl/> Meanwhile, budget transatlantic air rival 
Norwegian Air is posting prices upwards of $275.<nl/> So what's the catch? WOW Air is a notorious budget carrier, 
along the lines of the Spirit, Ryanair, and Allegiant brands. They identify as part of the "ultra-low-cost long haul" 
category, in which they're shooting to become the industry leader.<nl/> Currently rated at 2.5 stars on Yelp[1], 
you're going to have to pony up[2] for traditional carrier amenities. It's $25 for an aisle seat; $10 for seat assignment 
in advance; up to $48 for an extra five inches of legroom; a $48 fee for "overweight" carry-on luggage, which means 
anything over 11 lbs.; and $67 or more for checked luggage. Reviewers also mention that in-flight refreshments are 
not free. <nl/> Still, since they launched Boston and Washington, DC low-cost routes in 2015, they've grown 
substantially, running at 90% capacity this year and expecting to double their passenger capacity this year.<nl/> 
"We have had a tremendously positive response to our low prices on our current transatlantic routes and this gives 
us confidence that passengers will take up the chance to travel even further afield," said CEO and Founder Skuli 
Mogenson in a statement posted on their site[3]. <nl/> You'll be flying in one of three new Airbus A330-300 aircraft 
that WOW purchased just for these routes, each holding up to 340 passengers. And there will be no "upgrades" to 
business class, as WOW flies single class only. <nl/> Don't get too excited about making an affordable last-minute 
escape to Europe this winter, though. A quick search shows that their $199 deals are booked out to most 
destinations through the fall of 2016. But you know what they say: Paris is always a good idea. It'll be lovely next 
October, especially for just $199.<nl/>NOW WATCH: The 10 best cities in the world, according to 
travelers[4]<nl/>See Also: The safest low-cost airlines[5]The most popular places to travel this winter, according to 
TripAdvisor[6]This is the most affordable time of year to visit the 39 most popular cities in the US[7] SEE ALSO: 100 
trips everyone should take in their lifetime[8]<nl/> DON'T FORGET: Follow Business Insider's lifestyle page on 
Facebook![9]<nl/> [ 1]: http://www.yelp.com/biz/wow-air-boston [ 2]:            https://wowair.us/travel-info/fees-

Ryanair Opens New Base at Belfast Airport
Ryanair Opens New Base at Belfast Airport
FFT.ie
January 8, 2016 Friday 5:45 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 348 words
Byline: Mark Murphy
Body
Jan 07, 2016( FFT.ie: http://www.fft.ie Delivered by Newstex) <nl/>            http://www.fft.ie/wp-
content/uploads/2016/01/ryanairbelfastgatwick.jpgThe first route, Belfast to London Gatwick, will begin operating 
this March.<nl/>
Budget airline Ryanair has announced the opening of a new base at Belfast International Airport, after an absence 
of almost six years from the city.<nl/> The company has said that 90 jobs will be created as a result of the move, 
while upwards of 750 could be created over the course of the next 18 months.<nl/> Ryanair is confident the new 
routes will bring an additional one million passengers to the airport, and will be starting a four times daily service to 
London Gatwick from this March. Five more routes are planned to operate from the airport, however the airline 
won't be unveiling these routes until October 2016.<nl/> Currently, the landing slots for Belfast flights at Gatwick are 
occupied by Aer Lingus. As part of its takeover conditions by International Airlines Group, Aer Lingus must 
relinquish the slots by March 2016.<nl/> Ryanair had left Belfast City Airport in 2010 after delays in a planned 
runway extension, which the airline had wanted in order to operate flights to more European destinations.<nl/> 'We 
are hopeful that we can introduce some new European routes of a business nature and some sunshine routes at 
much-needed lower fares,' said Ryanair's chief commercial officer David O'Brien.<nl/> Belfast International Airport 
managing director, Graham Keddie, said: 'This is a most welcome announcement. The jobs and investment are 
considerable and amount to a valuable inward investment at low or no cost to the taxpayer.'<nl/> Niall Gibbons, 
CEO of Tourism Ireland, said: 'This announcement is good news for tourism to Northern Ireland, as we kick off our 
2016 promotional drive, particularly given Ryanair's statement to introduce additional flights this autumn. We 
already work closely with Ryanair and we look forward to co-operating with them to maximise the promotion of this 
new flight from London Gatwick to Belfast.'<nl/>

Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Receives Consensus Recommendation of 'Buy' from Brokerages
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Receives Consensus 
Recommendation of 'Buy' from Brokerages
The Legacy
January 4, 2016 Monday 9:58 PM EST
Copyright 2016 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 639 words
Byline: Reagan
Body
Jan 04, 2016( The Legacy: http://www.localizedusa.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/>            
http://stocktwits.com/widgets/share <nl/> Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) have been given a 
consensus rating of 'Buy' by the sixteen research firms that are currently covering the firm, MarketBeat reports[1]. 
One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have issued a hold rating, seven have assigned a buy 
rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the company. 
The average twelve-month price target among brokerages that have covered the stock in the last year is $86.88. 
<nl/> Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[2]) traded down 2.735% on Monday, hitting $84.095. The stock had a 
trading volume of 79,836 shares. The stock has a market cap of $22.19 billion and a P/E ratio of 14.086. The 
company's 50-day moving average is $82.09 and its 200-day moving average is $78.95. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 
one year low of $62.53 and a one year high of $88.24. <nl/> Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its 
earnings results on Monday, November 2nd. The company reported $0.99 earnings per share for the quarter, 
missing the consensus estimate of $3.30 by $2.31. On average, analysts anticipate that Ryanair Holdings plc will 
post $5.15 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. <nl/> Several research analysts recently weighed in on 
RYAAY shares. HSBC lowered Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research report on 
Friday, October 2nd. Vetr[3] raised Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'strong-buy' rating and set a $90.63 
target price on the stock in a research report on Monday, November 16th. Beaufort Securities reaffirmed a 'buy' 
rating on shares of Ryanair Holdings plc in a research report on Tuesday, October 6th. Zacks Investment 
Research[4] lowered Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research report on Friday, 
November 20th. Finally, Raymond James raised Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'market perform' rating to an 
'outperform' rating in a research report on Tuesday, November 3rd.<nl/><nl/> Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[5]) is a holding company for Ryanair Limited (Ryanair). Ryanair operates a low fare, scheduled-
passenger airline serving short-haul, point-to-point routes between Ireland, the United Kingdom, Continental Europe 
and Morocco. The Company's principal fleet consists of Boeing 737-800 aircraft, each having 189 seats. The 
Company offered over 1,600 short-haul flights per day serving approximately 190 airports across Europe, and flying 
approximately 1,600 routes, with a fleet of approximately 315 Boeing 737-800 aircraft and six additional leased 
aircraft acquired on short term leases. Ryanair's fleet totaled to 308 Boeing 737-800s. Ryanair also provides 
various ancillary services and engages in other activities connected with its air passenger service, including non-
flight scheduled services, Internet-related services, and the in-flight sale of beverages, food and 
merchandise.<nl/><nl/>This story was originally published by Putnam Standard (http://putnamstandard.com) and is 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Receives Consensus Recommendation of 'Buy' from Brokerages
the sole property of Putnam Standard. If you are reading this article on another website, that means this article was 
illegally copied and re-published to this website in violation of U.S. and International copyright law. You can view the 
original version of this story at            http://putnamstandard.com/2016/01/04/ryanair-holdings-plc-nasdaqryaay-
receives-consensus-recommendation-of-buy-from-brokerages/717791/<nl/>
