Ryanair Holdings plc Trading Down 3.1% (RYAAY)
Ryanair Holdings plc Trading Down 3.1% (RYAAY)
The Legacy
November 25, 2015 Wednesday 3:10 AM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 524 words
Byline: Noah
Body
Nov 25, 2015( The Legacy: http://www.localizedusa.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) was down 3.1% on Tuesday , MarketBeat[1] reports. The stock traded as low as $76.48 and 
last traded at $77.23, with a volume of 315,132 shares traded. 
The stock had previously closed at $79.67.<nl/> A number of research analysts recently commented on the 
company. HSBC downgraded Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a report on Friday, 
October 2nd. Vetr[2] upgraded Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'strong-buy' rating and set a $90.63 
price target on the stock in a research report on Monday, November 16th. Beaufort Securities restated a 'buy' rating 
on shares of Ryanair Holdings plc in a research report on Tuesday, October 6th. Cantor Fitzgerald lowered Ryanair 
Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research note on Monday, August 10th. Finally, Zacks 
Investment Research[3] lowered Ryanair Holdings plc from a 'buy' rating to a 'hold' rating in a research note on 
Friday. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have issued a hold rating, seven have assigned a 
buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the stock. The stock has a consensus rating of 'Buy' and an 
average target price of $86.88.<nl/> The company has a 50 day moving average of $80.86 and a 200 day moving 
average of $76.59. The firm has a market capitalization of $20.54 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 
13.21.<nl/><nl/>Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, November 
2nd. The company reported $0.99 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates 
of $3.30 by $2.31. Equities analysts expect that Ryanair Holdings plc will post $5.11 EPS for the current year.<nl/> 
The business also recently disclosed a dividend, which will be paid on Friday, November 27th. Investors of record 
on Tuesday, October 27th will be given a $1.635 dividend. The ex-dividend date is Friday, October 23rd.<nl/> 
Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4]) is a holding company for Ryanair Limited (Ryanair). Ryanair operates a 
low fare, scheduled-passenger airline serving short-haul, point-to-point routes between Ireland, the United 
Kingdom, Continental Europe and Morocco. The Company's principal fleet consists of Boeing 737-800 aircraft, 
each having 189 seats. The Company offered over 1,600 short-haul flights per day serving approximately 190 
airports across Europe, and flying approximately 1,600 routes, with a fleet of approximately 315 Boeing 737-800 
aircraft and six additional leased aircraft acquired on short term leases. Ryanair's fleet totaled to 308 Boeing 737-
800s. Ryanair also provides various ancillary services and engages in other activities connected with its air 
passenger service, including non-flight scheduled services, Internet-related services, and the in-flight sale of 
beverages, food and merchandise.<nl/> [ 1]: http://www.marketbeat.com [ 2]:            http://www.vetr.com/ [ 3]:            
http://www.zacks.com/ [ 4]:            http://www.marketbeat.com/stocks/NASDAQ/RYAAY/

Behavioural science, customer experience and why we should test more things - Interview with Rory 
Sutherland of #ogilvychange
Behavioural science, customer experience and why we should test more 
things - Interview with Rory Sutherland of #ogilvychange
Adrian Swinscoe - RARE Business Growth Marketing
November 20, 2015 Friday 11:02 AM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 2385 words
Byline: adrianswinscoe Adrian Swinscoe
Body
Nov 20, 2015( Adrian Swinscoe - RARE Business Growth ...rketing: http://www.adrianswinscoe.com/blog/ Delivered 
by Newstex) ;;<nl/> Podcast: Play in new window[1] | Download[2]<nl/><nl/>Today's interview is with Rory 
Sutherland who is Vice-Chairman, Ogilvy ...ther UK[3] and co-founder of #ogilvychange[4]. The Ogilvy ...ther Group 
UK is made up of 10 companies that work across a range of marketing disciplines. #ogilvychange is their specialist 
behavioural science practice that uses the latest thinking in cognitive psychology, social psychology and 
behavioural economics to help their clients create behavioural change in the real world.<nl/>
<nl/>Rory is a leading thinker in the marketing and advertising space and a huge proponent of how the application 
of insights from cognitive psychology and behavioural economics can positively impact business and customers. As 
a result, Rory joins me today to talk about behavioural economics, psychology, customer experience, the big impact 
that small changes can have and what business can and should be learning and doing with these insights.<nl/> 
This interview follows on from my recent interview - How to enhance, extend and crowd source your in-field 
customer service - Interview with Manuel Grenacher of Mila[5] - and is number 159 in the series of interviews[6] 
with authors and business leaders that are doing great things, helping businesses innovate and delivering great 
service and experience to their customers.<nl/> Note: The interview was recorded at The Grand in Brighton and so 
there is some background noise. However, it doesn't spoil the recording and you can still hear our conversation just 
fine. Enjoy.<nl/> Highlights of my interview with Rory:<nl/>Rory has worked in advertising for about 27 years and 
started in direct marketing, which he believes is a very good place to start as it is like a self funding behavioural 
science experiment as you get to test different creative approaches and you see what happens. After 'discovering' 
economics he found that economists view of human behaviour was naive in the extreme. Thus, he became an early 
convert to and evangelist of behavioural science. He describes himself as a behavioural science impresario. He 
established #ogilvychange where they help private, public and charitable clients harness the power and insights of 
behavioural science. When people think about behavioural science these days they often think that it is all about 
finding 'nudges'. But, in fact, their first job is their work is to remove 'anti-nudges' i.e. little things that stop people 
from doing certain things or feeling comfortable about taking on a new action (like the concept of 'grit'[7] that I have 
talked about before). An example Rory cites is when you go to a posh hotel it is considered mandatory that even 
before you have checked in that someone offers to take your bags. However, most people hate this as they have 
just spent hours traveling on a plane and going through airports thinking 'don't forget my luggage, don't lose my 
luggage, where's my luggage etc etc'. So, when they are presented with a complete stranger offering to take their 
Behavioural science, customer experience and why we should test more things - Interview with Rory 
Sutherland of #ogilvychange
bags from them their unconscious brains very negatively to this. Most hotels think that this is adding service. But, to 
many people it is the last thing they need or want before they have even checked in or know their room number. 
Behavioural science has enormous economic value simply through creating uncertainty about conventional 
economics. The pervasiveness of assumptions and beliefs in business and economics like efficiency is the greatest 
god, price reduction is the best thing that you can do for a consumer and that value is intrinsic in the thing that you 
do and not in the perception of that thing reduces the bio-diversity in the world of business beliefs. As a result, this 
makes business worse as it tends to make everyone the same and reduces the number of people and businesses 
that strive for difference. Moreover, businesses can believe different things and both be right. Just look at Lidl and 
Waitrose. Dissident opinion judged by the market has very interesting outcomes. To some extent, Easyjet wouldn't 
be nearly as good if it wasn't for Ryanair and British Airways arguably needs low-cost airlines to justify high-cost 
flying. The idea that there is one-truth is something that we have to fight. Behavioural science, at the very least, 
creates debate around what people really want and how that changes over time i.e. consider what we want from an 
airport now and what we wanted from an airport in 1997. Truth varies from person to person and over time. 
Reminded me of a funny Billy Connolly sketch about demands from the women's movement.[8] Small things can 
very big effects. Rory cites an example of going to Wagamama, a restaurant, where as you enter the restaurant 
they explain what happens and why it happens. This is hugely important in setting expectations and the frame in 
which service is delivered. The whole experience would be completely different if this wasn't done. With a bit of 
contextual framing you can make something that is rubbish appear brilliant. The addition of a tiny little nudge at the 
right place and time in an experience can make a huge difference. The Peak End Rule is worth knowing as it is a 
phenomena where 'people judge an experience largely based on how they felt at its peak (i.e., its most intense 
point) and at its end, rather than based on the total sum or average of every moment of the experience.'[9] Another 
phenomena that is worth paying attention to is the Von Restorff spike[10], which is our propensity to notice and 
remember anything that stands out or is unusual (good or bad) and how that influences our perception of everything 
else we have experienced. An example of these things in practice can be seen in hotels where if you have a good 
check-in experience you will go around looking for other evidence to corroborate your perception. The converse, of 
course, is true too. The Kano effect[11] is another interesting phenomena that is worth paying attention to. It 
originates from Professor Noriaki Kano[12] who found that different product attributes will produce no delight if 
present but infuriation if absent. Moreover, other features may produce insane delight but be completely tangential 
to the service or product being provided. The idea that you can improve business by completely removing human 
agency is deranged. The reasons that we do things and the reasons we react to things are not well described by 
the explanations we give. Because we don't really understand what generates emotional stress in us then we often 
misrepresent the elements of the problem that annoys us. Thoughts are much less important than feelings when it 
comes to determining human behaviour. Feelings are probably better than rationality at synthesising multiple 
sources of information in different contexts. Mass market players like Costa Coffee, Starbucks, Travelodge etc etc 
have made it possible for the independent sector to do much better because they have helped eliminate the worst 
50% of independent coffee shops and hotels by setting the base standard so high. Check out Rory's TED talk 
'Sweat 
The 
Small 
Stuff[13]'. 
Below 
is 
one 
of 
the 
diagrams 
he 
uses 
in 
his 
talk:<nl/>http://ericlanke.blogspot.co.uk/2011/10/chief-detail-officer.html;<nl/>In his talk he advocates for the 
creation of a new position called the Chief Detail Officer, who has lots of power and influence but no budget. 
However, one of the challenges in corporate environments is that many of the details or small things are dismissed 
as trivial but yet those little things could be the thing that delivers the Von Restorff spike[14] that businesses crave 
and define the customer experience.<nl/>Rory is a big fan of board level Chief Customer Officers and/or Chief 
Experience Officers and was delighted to see that British Airways have now appointed a Chief Experience Officer 
who sits on their board but also that he has come from the hotel industry and not the airline industry. TripAdvisor 
adds a lot of value to cafes and restaurants in terms of framing and positioning. For example, if a restaurant serves 
great food but the service is generally rated as being a bit flaky and you read a review to that effect then that sets 
the expectation of what to expect. Therefore, if you go and the food is great and the service is a bit flaky then the 
place has met your expectations. However, if the service is better than you expect then you will tend to be surprised 
and delighted. We like things that we have chosen more than things that are imposed on us. That's why we like 
seat 17A on an airplane more if we have chosen it than if it was randomly allocated to us. Knowing these things and 
using them can help make people happier and not destroy value through bad framing or presentation. Ludwig von 
Mises[15] and the Austrian School of Economics understood this best where they believed that economics should 
Behavioural science, customer experience and why we should test more things - Interview with Rory 
Sutherland of #ogilvychange
be a subordinate discipline to psychology or Praxeology[16], 'the deductive study of human action'. We use our 
judgement of things we do understand as proxies to help us judge things that we do not understand. Satisficing[17] 
is worth paying attention to too as it is a decision-making strategy that means that rather looking for the optimal 
solution we look through the available alternatives until some level of acceptability is reached and we choose that 
option. One of the things that rationalists, intrinsicists, intellectuals and economists get wrong is their predictions 
about how online retail is going to be a bigger proportion of retail in 20 years time than it will be. The reason being is 
that they ignore the context within which many things are bought and also how the choices that customers make 
really appear in the brain as opposed to how they do in a very simplified model. To get started learning about all of 
this stuff, Rory recommends reading a few books including Daniel Kahneman's Thinking, Fast and Slow[18], Cass 
Sunstein and Richard Thaler's Nudge[19] as well as Ben Goldacre and Stuart Sutherland's Irrationality[20] and 
Robert Frank's The Darwin Economy[21]. Be less sure. Most things in human behaviour aren't hard and fast rules. 
So, the best thing business can do is have a wider Overton Window[22] of what is possible and, therefore, they 
should test more things. The thing that Rory wants to plug comes from one of their clients and is the Philips 
Airfryer[23], which, he says, is a tremendous product that cooks great food through the use of superheated air and 
very little to no fat. The product sells very well in Asia because in Asia 'frying' is synonymous with cooking. 
However, it doesn't sell so well in the UK because 'frying' is associated with unhealthy eating and so it isn't 
positioned well in the mind of customers. But, the ironic thing is that it is a very healthy way of cooking and when 
people buy one they love it. So, Rory says buy one and he'll be amazed if you are disappointed. Mentally the 
product hasn't been framed in the way that helps UK customers buy it.<nl/>About Rory (taken and adapted from his 
Ogilvy Change bio)<nl/> Rory Sutherland is the Vice-Chairman, Ogilvy ...ther UK[24] and co-founder of 
#ogilvychange[25].<nl/> In 2012 Sutherland was awarded a prestigious 25th anniversary IDM Honorary Fellowship 
at the Institute's flagship event, the IDM Annual Lecture. Rory received the IDM's only 2012 Honorary Fellowship 
award for his outstanding contribution to the direct and digital marketing profession.<nl/> With the discovery of 
behavioural economics, Rory found that it was a serious academic discipline that can positively impact 
business.<nl/> He shares lots of behavioural insights and other observations with his TED talks[26], through writing 
The Spectator's 'Wiki Man' column[27] and his busy Twitter account @rorysutherland[28] (Do say Hello!).<nl/> <nl/>

November 19, 2015 Thursday 5:38 PM EST

Nov 19, 2015 (Market News Video:http://marketnewsvideo.com/ Delivered by Newstex)
 Comparing units outstanding versus one week ago at the coverage universe of ETFs at ETF Channel, the biggest 
inflow was seen in the iShares Core MSCI EAFE ETF (IEFA), which added 19,300,000 units, or a 14.7% increase 
week over week. Among the largest underlying components of IEFA, in morning trading today Ryanair Holdings 
(RYAAY) is up about 0.4%. 
And on a percentage change basis, the ETF with the biggest increase in inflows was the ProShares Ultra MSCI 
EAFE (EFO), which added 75,000 units, for a 33.3% increase in outstanding units.

Airlines Gone Crackers: Airport Parking and Hotels (APH) Compares Airline Policies for Travelling with 
Christmas and New Year Party 'Essentials'
Airlines Gone Crackers: Airport Parking and Hotels (APH) Compares Airline 
Policies for Travelling with Christmas and New Year Party 'Essentials'
Pressat
November 16, 2015 Monday 5:32 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 692 words
Byline: Pressat
Body
Nov 16, 2015( Pressat: http://www.pressat.co.uk Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Monday 16 November, 2015<nl/> 
With just 39 days to go until Christmas, airports across the UK are warming up to transport millions of passengers 
across the globe for the festive season. Airport Parking ...tels (APH) has therefore put together a guide comparing 
the different airline policies for travelling with Christmas and New Year favourites such as Christmas crackers, gifts 
and party poppers, ensuring there are no hold-ups at the check-in desk. The research can be found in the Know 
Before You Go section of the APH website at            www.aph.com/christmascrackers.<nl/>
The research compares 14 airlines including Delta Air Lines, Monarch and Virgin Atlantic and compares their 
policies for carrying festive treats such as Christmas crackers, party poppers, sparklers and gifts as both hold and 
checked luggage. <nl/>For those not wanting to miss out on pulling a cracker abroad this Christmas, only two out of 
the 14 airlines in the study allow passengers to travel with crackers in their hand luggage including bmi regional and 
easyJet. Both of these airlines stipulated that the crackers must remain within their original packaging, with bmi 
regional restricting travellers to one box person whereas easyJet permits two boxes per traveller.<nl/>Passengers 
are more likely to be able to travel with crackers in their checked luggage, with eight of the surveyed airlines 
permitting crackers to be packed in the hold compartment. However, many of these airlines impose strict policies, 
for example Emirates state that permission must be granted by the airline at least three days before travel and 
easyJet make it compulsory that passengers inform check-in staff if they are carrying crackers. The strictest airlines 
in the survey include Delta Air Lines, KLM, Ryanair, Aer Lingus and Air France, all of whom do not permit Christmas 
crackers, sparklers and party poppers to be carried onboard.<nl/>When it comes to travelling with presents, Ryanair 
and British Airways both stipulate that presents must not be wrapped to allow security staff to access the parcels if 
necessary. Passengers flying with bmi regional must also note that Christmas trees and foliage are not 
recommended to be carried as checked luggage.<nl/>Passengers should also be reminded that strict restrictions 
apply across all airlines when it comes to carrying liquids in hand luggage, whereby liquids over 100ml are still not 
permitted. If travellers wish to carry festive favourites such as cranberry sauce or port, bottles over 100ml should be 
carried as part of checked luggage. <nl/>For further information on Airport Parking and Hotels (APH),Visit 
www.aph.com or call 01342 859515.<nl/>ENDS <nl/>About Airport Parking and Hotels (APH)Airport Parking and 
Hotels (APH) is the UK's award winning long stay airport parking operator and booking agency, after winning the 
Best Airport Parking Company for a fifth year running at British Travel Awards 2014. This year APH also celebrates 
its 34th year as a retailer and operator of pre-booked airport parking and travel extras. APH offers parking at all 
Airlines Gone Crackers: Airport Parking and Hotels (APH) Compares Airline Policies for Travelling with 
Christmas and New Year Party 'Essentials'
major UK airports as well as airport hotels packaged with parking and airport lounges. APH is also a carbon 
balanced company and has, through support of the World Land Trust, helped purchase more than 1,000 acres of 
endangered rainforest.<nl/>Whether you're taking golf-clubs, a snowboard, a bike or a baby seat on holiday, finding 
out which regulations you have to adhere to can be a headache. To help cut through all the mouse-clicking, Airport 
Parking and Hotels (APH) have created a online baggage allowance finder which is easy-to-use and regularly 
updated with the latest information. The tool can be accessed at the following URL:            
www.aph.com/community/baggage-allowances. <nl/>Media EnquiriesSarah Salord / Lauren Hill / McCluskey 
International / 020 8747 2170 /aph@mccluskey.co.uk;<nl/><nl/> No media attached. Please contact Pressat Wire 
for more information.<nl/><nl/> Distributed by            http://www.pressat.co.uk/[1]<nl/> [ 1]:            
http://www.pressat.co.uk/

Stocks Set For Soft Start; Dillard's Plunges In Premarket
Stocks Set For Soft Start; Dillard's Plunges In Premarket
Stock Market Today
November 16, 2015 Monday 2:29 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 619 words
Body
Nov 16, 2015( Stock Market Today: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> 
Stock futures changed their tune and pointed to a slightly weaker start for the stock market today[1]. Nasdaq 100 
futures fell 5 points vs. fair value, and S...00 futures lost a point. 
Futures on the Dow Jones industrial average gave up 12 points.<nl/> The stock market ended a six-week winning 
streak last week amid a pickup in distribution days, which prompted a downgrade of the market outlook[2].<nl/> 
Stock markets overseas were mixed. In Europe, France's CAC-40 slipped 0.2% after Friday's series of attacks by 
the Islamic State that left more than 100 dead. Germany's DAX rose 0.2%, and London's FTSE climbed 0.3%.<nl/> 
In Asia, Hong Kong's Hang Seng fell 1%, and Japan's Nikkei slumped 1.7%. But the Shanghai composite reversed 
higher to a 0.7% gain.<nl/> Crude oil jumped more than 2% to $41.68 a barrel on potential supply disruptions. Oil 
prices hit their lowest levels in over two months last week.<nl/> Safe-haven instruments such as bonds and the 
dollar were trading higher. Gold was also higher, up about 1% to $1,091.20 an ounce.<nl/> In economic news[3], 
the Empire State index for November came in at minus 10.7 vs. the consensus estimate of minus 5 from 
Econoday.<nl/> A number of central bank officials will be speaking throughout the week, starting Tuesday with Fed 
Governor Jerome Powell. The minutes from the Fed's October meeting are due Wednesday.<nl/> In stocks, 
Starwood Hotels ...sorts (NYSE:HOT[4]) fell 6% in premarket trading despite news of it being bought by Marriott 
International (NASDAQ:MAR[5]) for $12.2 billion in cash and stock. The deal would create the world's biggest hotel 
chain.<nl/> Dillard's (NYSE:DDS[6]) slumped 10% in premarket trading after posting disappointing quarterly results. 
The department store operator said it earned $1.19 a share, including an after-tax credit of 16 cents a share. Sales 
slipped to $1.435 billion. Views were for EPS of $1.20 on revenue of $1.49 billion. Rival Macy's (NYSE:M[7]) 
plunged 20% last week on disappointing quarterly sales[8] and a weak outlook.<nl/> Airline stocks were lower in 
premaket activity on concerns on Friday's attacks on tourism. Shares of American Airlines Group 
(NASDAQ:AAL[9]), Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL[10]), United Continental (NYSE:UAL[11]) and Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[12]) were off more than 1%.<nl/> Both the NYSE and the Nasdaq will observe a minute of 
silence at 9:25 a.m. ET for the victims in the Paris terrorist attack Friday.<nl/> Follow Vincent Mao on Twitter 
@IBD_VMao[13].<nl/>

JNK, EUMV: Big ETF Outflows
JNK, EUMV: Big ETF Outflows
Market News Video
November 12, 2015 Thursday 4:13 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 184 words
Body
View Video
Nov 12, 2015 (Market News Video:http://marketnewsvideo.com/ Delivered by Newstex)
 Looking at units outstanding versus one week prior within the universe of ETFs covered at ETF Channel, the 
biggest outflow was seen in the SPDR Barclays High Yield Bond ETF (JNK), where 33,750,000 units were 
destroyed, or a 9.9% decrease week over week. 
And on a percentage change basis, the ETF with the biggest outflow was the iShares MSCI Europe Minimum 
Volatility ETF (EUMV), which lost 750,000 of its units, representing a 36.6% decline in outstanding units compared 
to the week prior. Among the largest underlying components of EUMV, in morning trading today Ryanair Holdings 
(RYAAY) is up about 0.2%.

of

Barclays High Yield Bond ETF (JNK), where 33,750,000 units were destroyed, or a 9. 9% decrease week over 
week.

Lufthansa strike takes off after court ruling
Lufthansa strike takes off after court ruling
Deutsche Welle Business
November 11, 2015 Wednesday 7:28 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 506 words
Body
Nov 11, 2015( Deutsche Welle Business: http://www.dw-world.de/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> A German court has 
struck down a Lufthansa injunction aimed at ending a walkout by the airline's cabin crew, setting the stage for a 
nasty battle that could see thousands more flights being cancelled in the days ahead. 
A labor court in Dusseldorf, Germany, ruled on Wednesday that cabin crew union UFO must be allowed to continue 
its industrial action at the German carrier at least until Friday. The court followed a similar ruling by the labor court in 
Darmstadt earlier in the day, which has jurisdiction for Frankfurt and Munich airports.<nl/> Lufthansa had sought to 
challenge the legality of the industrial action through court injunctions claiming the union's reasons for striking were 
"too vague" and unjustified under German labor law. The Dusseldorf court, however, dismissed the claim saying 
UFO's aims were "sufficiently clear" and "not exaggerated."<nl/> The UFO union welcomed the ruling on its 
website, calling for the strike to continue from 0300 GMT on Wednesday until 2300 GMT on Friday across all flights 
at Frankfurt, Munich and Dusseldorf airports.<nl/> Lufthansa grounded<nl/> The new flight cancellations come after 
four days of stoppages that have already forced the airline to cancel 2,800 flights, leaving 330,000 passengers 
stranded. On Wednesday alone, Lufthansa was forced to scrap 930 flights, grounding 100,000 passengers. For 
Thursday, the airline plans to cancel 933 flights, affecting a total of 107,000 passengers.<nl/> Lufthansa and UFO 
have been locked in a battle for nearly two years, in which management has sought to change early retirement 
provisions for their cabin crews. While UFO wants them to remain unchanged, Lufthansa argues that the system is 
too expensive in the face of cut-throat competition from low-cost operators such as Ryanair and Easyjet. <nl/> 
Entrenched positions<nl/> On Monday, the airline presented a new offer to the union, with improved bonuses and 
retirement provisions, but UFO called it unacceptable.<nl/> In a statement issued on Wednesday, the airlines chief 
executive (CEO) Carsten Spohr said Lufthansa could not endanger its future by ceding to the union's demands. He 
added that the dispute would run for "as long as necessary," even though he admitted that "each day of strike is 
one too many."<nl/> Spohr also called on UFO to allow an independent arbiter to find a solution in the dispute - an 
offer which union boss Nicoley Baublies ruled out for the duration of the strike.<nl/> Earlier this year, the German 
carrier was already hit by a dispute with its pilots over early retirement payments. The pilots were also concerned 
about management plans to expand the airline's low-cost activities and staged a series of walkouts that cost 
Lufthansa 350 million euros ($375 million). The pilots' strike was finally stopped by a German court which argued 
the union demands were not clearly linked to wage issues and working conditions.<nl/> uhe/hch (dpa, AFP, 
Reuters)<nl/> 
Load-Date: November 11, 2015
Lufthansa strike takes off after court ruling
End of Document
National Geographic Traveller Reader Awards Shortlist Announced
National Geographic Traveller Reader Awards Shortlist Announced
SourceWire
November 11, 2015 Wednesday 9:43 AM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1345 words
Body
Nov 11, 2015( SourceWire: http://www.sourcewire.com Delivered by Newstex) ;;<nl/> National Geographic Traveller 
Reader Awards 2015, in association with Qatar Tourism Authority<nl/>SHORTLIST ANNOUNCED<nl/>           
http://www.natgeotraveller.co.uk/readerawards[1]<nl/><nl/>LONDON (11 November) — The shortlist has been 
announced for the inaugural National Geographic Traveller Reader Awards 2015, in association with Qatar Tourism 
Authority. 
Readers of one of the UK's best-loved travel magazines voted for their favourite destination, airline, tour operator 
and more, with the winners announced during a ceremony in London this November and in the Jan/Feb issue of 
National Geographic Traveller (UK).<nl/><nl/>Pat Riddell, editor of National Geographic Traveller (UK), said: 'These 
inaugural awards were the ideal platform for readers to air their views, have their say and let us know what they 
relish about travel the most. We're excited to see the results and look forward to celebrating with the category 
winners this month. A big thanks to all those who put forward their views and also to all our sponsors who have 
made this happen in our first event of this kind.'<nl/><nl/>Those who entered were rewarded with the opportunity to 
win a number of fabulous prizes including a seven-night escape to Morocco, courtesy of Rickshaw Travel; a week's 
winter luxury trip to France, courtesy of AliKats Mountain Holidays; and a long UK weekend, courtesy of Natural 
Retreats. Twenty National Geographic Traveller (UK) subscriptions and four Amazon Kindles were also up for 
grabs.<nl/><nl/>

natgeotraveller.co.uk<nl/><nl/>National Geographic Traveler (USA) is the world's most widely read travel 
magazine, created in 1984. It championed sustainable travel before it was cool and, eight times annually, 
celebrates journeys that are about place, experience, culture, authenticity, living like the locals and great 
photography. It makes a distinction between tourism and travel and stresses inquisitive, not acquisitive, trips. It 
employs storytelling and outstanding photography to inspire readers to pick up and go, eschewing fashion and fluff 
in favour of articles that offer a strong sense of place, inspiring narratives that make readers take trips, and solid 
service information to help them plan those trips.<nl/><nl/>The National Geographic Society is one of the world's 
largest nonprofit scientific and educational organisations. Founded in 1888 to 'increase and diffuse geographic 
knowledge,' the Society's mission is to inspire people to care about the planet. National Geographic reflects the 
world through its magazines, television programs, films, music and radio, books, DVDs, maps, exhibitions, live 
events, school publishing programs, interactive media and merchandise. National Geographic magazine, the 
Society's official journal, published in English and 33 <nl/>local-language editions, is read by more than 40 million 
people each month. The National Geographic Channel reaches 370 million households in 34 languages in 168 
countries. National Geographic Digital Media receives more than 15 million visitors a month. National Geographic 
has funded more than 9,600 scientific research, conservation and exploration projects and supports an education 
program promoting geography literacy. For more information, visit nationalgeographic.com<nl/>###<nl/>

National Geographic Traveller Reader Awards 2015, in Association With Qatar Tourism Authority, Shortlist 
Announced
National Geographic Traveller Reader Awards 2015, in Association With 
Qatar Tourism Authority, Shortlist Announced
Pressat
November 11, 2015 Wednesday 11:29 AM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1253 words
Byline: Pressat
Body
Nov 11, 2015( Pressat: http://www.pressat.co.uk Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Wednesday 11 November, 2015<nl/> 
The shortlist has been announced for the inaugural National Geographic Traveller Reader Awards 2015, in 
association with Qatar Tourism Authority. Readers of one of the UK's best-loved travel magazines voted for their 
favourite destination, airline, tour operator and more, with the winners announced during a ceremony in London this 
November and in the Jan/Feb issue ofNational Geographic Traveller (UK).<nl/>
Pat Riddell, editor of National Geographic Traveller (UK), said: 'These inaugural awards were the ideal platform for 
readers to air their views, have their say and let us know what they relish about travel the most. We're excited to 
see the results and look forward to celebrating with the category winners this month. A big thanks to all those who 
put forward their views and also to all our sponsors who have made this happen in our first event of this 
kind.'<nl/>Those who entered were rewarded with the opportunity to win a number of fabulous prizes including a 
seven-night escape to Morocco, courtesy of Rickshaw Travel; a week's winter luxury trip to France, courtesy of 
AliKats Mountain Holidays; and a long UK weekend, courtesy of Natural Retreats. Twenty National Geographic 
Traveller(UK) subscriptions and four Amazon Kindles were also up for grabs.<nl/>2015 READER AWARDS

IEFA, SRS: Big ETF Inflows

 Comparing units outstanding versus one week ago at the coverage universe of ETFs at ETF Channel, the biggest 
inflow was seen in the iShares Core MSCI EAFE ETF (IEFA), which added 5,100,000 units, or a 4.0% increase 
week over week. Among the largest underlying components of IEFA, in morning trading today Ryanair Holdings

Estate (SRS), which added 150,000 units, for a 25.2% increase in outstanding units.

Aldi and Lidl named world's top brands for shopping experience
Aldi and Lidl named world's top brands for shopping experience
Business Matters
November 9, 2015 Monday 5:28 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 417 words
Byline: Business Matters
Body
Nov 09, 2015( Business Matters: http://www.bmmagazine.co.uk/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Discount 
supermarkets Aldi and Lidl have been named the world's top brands for giving customers a simple, clear and 
hassle-free shopping experience.<nl/>
<nl/> Aldi topped the annual Global Brand Simplicity Index from US-based brand consultancy Siegel ...le for the 
sixth year in a row, reports The Telegraph[1].<nl/><nl/> The index polled 12,000 people and ranked 87 brands 
worldwide in order of the clarity and simplicity of their products and the way they communicate with 
shoppers.<nl/><nl/> Aldi and its counterpart Lidl, which took third place, were praised for expanding their range of 
products their and strongly-communicated 'money-saving' messages. Google took second place in the list.<nl/> 
Siegel ...le said 63pc of consumers are willing to pay more for a simple retail experience, making it ironic that the list 
is constistently topped by the budget supermarket chains. More than half of adults in the UK now visit an Aldi or Lidl 
each year.[2]<nl/> 'Brands that offer simpler customer experiences are rewarded with passionate customer loyalty, 
more innovative employees and greater revenue. In short, embracing simplicity improves the bottom line for brands 
and organisations,' said Howard Belk of Siegel ...le.<nl/> Aldi has topped a number of brand surveys in recent 
years. Earlier this year, its brand value surpassed that of Tesco for the first time, reflecting consumers' growing 
preference for smaller, discount stores, according to WPP and Millward Brown's annual BrandZ report.<nl/> BrandZ 
calculated Aldi's brand value as $11.7m compared to Tesco's $9.4m.<nl/> Netflix, which is now focusing on original 
feature films and TV series, took fourth place in Siegel ...le's list.<nl/> Fast food chains McDonald's, Burger King 
and KFC also made the top 10, appealing to a wide range of consumers.<nl/> Banks and insurance companies 
dominated the bottom 10. Ryanair was ranked third from last, despite its recent attempts to be more 'cuddly'.<nl/> [

ector%2Fretailandconsumer%2F11983715%2FAldi-and-Lidl-named-worlds-top-brands-for-shopping-
experience.html...f=rss

Lufthansa strike keeps passengers on the ground and in the dark
Lufthansa strike keeps passengers on the ground and in the dark
Deutsche Welle Germany
November 6, 2015 Friday 5:22 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 971 words
Body
Nov 06, 2015( Deutsche Welle Germany: http://www.dw.de/top-stories/germany/s-1432 Delivered by Newstex) 
<nl/> The striking cabin crew union's strategic secrecy has surprised throngs of customers and led Lufthansa to 
prepare for the worst. Jeffrey Michels reports from the Frankfurt Airport. 
Lufthansa is no stranger to strikes - its pilots halted service ten times in 2014 alone. But the cabin crew strike 
starting today portends to open a new chapter in the airlines' attempt to stay competitive at the expense of its 
workers.<nl/> <nl/> UFO, the Independent Flight Attendants Union, has kept quiet and continued to negotiate 
changes to its members' benefits while the pilots repeatedly went on strike. Yet after two years of frustration, its 
19,000 workers are taking to the picket line, too, in what has the potential to be the largest and longest strike in the 
company's history.<nl/> It certainly didn't seem like it could be, though.<nl/> At the Frankfurt Airport, where 
Lufthansa runs its largest number of flights, the terminal was calm. The departure board reported no cancellations. 
No one was panicking at any of the hundreds of Lufthansa counters.<nl/> This is because UFO is employing an 
interesting tactic in its strike - keeping its plans secret for as long as possible. The strike was announced Monday, 
declared officially yesterday, and given a general outline - listing only which airports, not which flights would be 
affected - this morning, only six hours before it was to come into effect.<nl/> As Lufthansa doesn't know which 
flights will be grounded, it must prepare for all of them to be.<nl/> 'All Lufthansa passengers therefore must expect 
that their flight could be cancelled on short notice,' union chief Nicolay Baublies explained.<nl/> To fly or not to fly 
<nl/> Today's confusion begins at the Lufthansa check-in counter. I ask a worker if he knows which flights will be 
canceled. 'Yes,' he says, confidently briefed, 'flights after 14:00.' Every flight? He hesitates. 'I'm not sure.' I ask him 
what is he expecting today? Again: 'I'm not sure.'<nl/> The yellow word 'annuliert' - cancelled - began trickling onto 
the flight board a little after 11:00. Lufthansa rolled out a free snack cart shortly thereafter.<nl/> A long row of 
counters were soon repurposed for customers to change their flights. Its line - flanked by purple-vested members of 
Lufthansa's 'passenger irregularity team' - quickly outnumbered those waiting to check-in.<nl/> One passenger had 
come into Frankfurt for a stopover from a business trip in Poland when he found out about his cancellation. 'I'm a bit 
disappointed they didn't tell me before I left. In Poland they didn't say anything, they just gave me my boarding 
pass.'<nl/> 'I want to go home to Vienna," said another customer, "but I don't think I'm coming home today." He 
added: 'It's like Kazakhstan, or Italy, or Athens. So many strikes.'<nl/> By the time of the strike's official start, the 
wait to rebook was well over an hour. Many passengers would have to be put into a hotel for the night to try again 
the next day, with no guarantee that they would be any luckier then. One group tried to make the most of it, belting 
songs and playing games. <nl/> Cutting edge or chopping board? <nl/> Under pressure to keep up with a rapidly 
changing airline market, Lufthansa has been undergoing a thorough restructuring of its operations. It is challenged 
on two fronts: by the surge of bare-bones, low-cost airlines within Europe, such as RyanAir and easyJet, on one 
Lufthansa strike keeps passengers on the ground and in the dark
end, and by the advance of international carriers with lower overheads outside of Europe, such as Emirates and 
Turkish Airlines, on the other.<nl/> To compete, analysts have urged the company to cut back on its largest 
expense beyond fuel - labor. CEO Carsten Spohr, who assumed his position in 2014 amid sinking profit projections, 
has pushed forward with the suggestions.<nl/> Central to the company's strategy is the expansion of its own low-
cost subsidiary Eurowings, whose cheaper tickets are made possible by reducing spending on its employees. The 
pilots' union sought to halt the expansion of Eurowings, until its strikes were deemed illegal by a German court for 
meddling in company strategy.<nl/> Learning from this lesson, UFO has focused its demands on its members' 
benefits most threatened by the expansion - chiefly pensions - instead of the expansion itself.<nl/> Value versus 
values <nl/> Where does customers' loyalty lie? With the workers, who would like a reason to serve with a genuine 
smile? Or with the company, who would like to get their customers where they need to be as cheaply as 
possible?<nl/> On top of the economic damage it can wreak, the fate of the strike lies in this answer. UFO knows 
this and is aware of the need to win over sympathy. Its task is to convince customers that the crew members are 
striking not out of choice, but because Lufthansa has made its own choice and refuses to budge.<nl/> So the union 
has railed this week against what is sees as Lufthansa's propaganda. In press statements in the lead-up to the 
strike, the company reiterated that it was offering everything that the union was demanding. The union intensely 
denies this, calling successive offers 'purely PR gags' and 'old wine in new bottles.'<nl/> In any case, like many 
travelers before it, the message may be getting lost in the massive Frankfurt Airport. Asked what he thought about 
the striker's demands, one customer in line to rebook his flight replied, 'Oh, I didn't know there was a strike.'<nl/> 
While people wait for the confusion to clear, one thing is certain: This won't be the last of it. This very week 
Lufthansa entered into negotiations with another union, Verdi, representing the company's labor on the ground and 
in cargo planes, about 33,000 workers in total.<nl/> 
Load-Date: November 6, 2015
End of Document

Stocks Higher In Afternoon; Ryanair Clears Buy Point
Stock Market Today
November 3, 2015 Tuesday 7:05 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 404 words
Body
Nov 03, 2015( Stock Market Today: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> 
Stocks extended gains in afternoon trading Tuesday, led by energy stocks as oil prices rose.<nl/>
 The Dow Jones industrial average gained 0.5%, while the Nasdaq rose 0.4% and the S...00 added 0.2% in the 
stock market today.[1] Volume was tracking higher on both the NYSE and the Nasdaq exchanges than on 
Monday.<nl/> Chevron (NYSE:CVX[2]) was up 3% and Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM[3]) climbed 2% as oil jumped 
above $47 a barrel after reports of a port shutdown in Libya.<nl/> Meanwhile, Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[4]), an 
Ireland-based short-haul airline, jumped 4% in heavy volume, clearing an 82.81 buy point of a late-stage flat base. 
Before the open, Raymond James upgraded the stock to outperform from market perform.<nl/> Supercomputer 
maker Cray (NASDAQ:CRAY[5]) soared 7% in heavy volume as it continues to rise following a blowout Q3 earnings 
report last Thursday. The stock, which had fallen as much as 50% from its 52-week high, is now just 6% off the 
peak after soaring back above its 50-day and 200-day moving averages.<nl/> Noah Holdings (NYSE:NOAH[6]), a 
Chinese provider of wealth management[7] services, jumped nearly 9% in huge volume.<nl/> Noah is due to report 
Q3 results Nov. 16. Profit for the period is seen rising 21% to 41 cents a share, which would be the biggest gain in 
four quarters.<nl/> The stock is climbing the right side of a deep base, but it's still 17% off its May peak.<nl/> On the 
downside, Taser International (NASDAQ:TASR[8]), maker of stun guns and police body cameras, dropped 14% 
after announcing that its Q3 profit plunged 79% from the same period last year. The result was much worse than 
expected. The stock sliced through its 50-day moving average.<nl/> [ 1]: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-

Stocks were drifting into slightly positive territory going into the lunch hour Tuesday. The Dow Jones industrial 
average gained 0.4%, while the Nasdaq and the S...00 rose a smidgen each in the stock market today[1].<nl/>

(NYSE:V[2]), up nearly 4%, more than recovering from a negative reaction to Monday's earnings report. Chevron

missing on earnings and reporting EPS that was 79% lower than a year earlier. The company has been focusing on 
body cameras, sales of which doubled from a year ago, while weapon sales dropped 1.2%. The stock tumbled 
14%, plunging through its 50-day moving average.<nl/> Wearable fitness gear maker Fitbit (NYSE:FIT[6]) deflated 
nearly 7%. It reported earnings and sales after the close Monday that beat estimates, and it raised guidance. But it 
also announced a 7-million-share secondary offering. The stock has still nearly doubled from its offering and 
remains above its 50-day moving average.<nl/> Semiconductor equipment maker Advanced Energy 
(NASDAQ:AEIS[7]) vaulted more than 2% after reporting earnings that beat estimates. It also broke out of a base 
on heavy volume.<nl/> Avis Budget (NASDAQ:CAR[8]) missed on earnings and lowered guidance. Its stock was 
trading 14% lower.<nl/> Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI[9]) was up 3.6% after a volatile morning. It will pay $5.9 
billion to buy Candy Crush maker[10] King Digital Entertainment (NYSE:KING[11]). King was up nearly 15%.<nl/> [

Alaska Airlines Adds Routes, Targets International Expansion
Alaska Airlines Adds Routes, Targets International Expansion
Zacks Investment Research
November 3, 2015 Tuesday 9:35 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 642 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Nov 03, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Alaska Airlines, the 
wholly owned subsidiary of Alaska Air Group ALK[1], has been making constant efforts to expand further in a bid to 
boost revenues and improve customer satisfaction. To that end, the company, of late, has been on a route addition 
spree. 
The latest move in this direction came with the Seattle-based carrier introducing two new routes connecting Los 
Angeles to San Jose and Liberia.<nl/>The carrier stated that it will offer eight flights per week on the two new 
routes. Costa Rica, a favorite tourist spot, is the first international destination for the carrier in 24 years. We remind 
investors that in 1991, the carrier had launched seasonal service to Magadan, Russia. Alaska Airlines stated in its 
press release that following the latest expansion initiative, it is now offering up to 80 peak season departures on a 
weekly basis from Southern California to Latin America.<nl/>While the flights connecting Los Angeles-San Jose will 
operate on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, the Los Angeles-Liberia service will take to the skies on 
Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays. Alaska Airlines is utilizing the fuel-efficient, next generation 737-800 
aircraft of The Boeing Company BA[2] on these routes. The aircraft is equipped with all modern facilities to enhance 
the flying experience of travelers.<nl/>The announcement of the new routes comes close on the heels of the 
company reporting higher-than-expected earnings and revenues in the third quarter of 2015. Results were aided by 
low fuel costs. The carrier is making huge savings, thanks to low fuel costs. In such a favorable backdrop, the plan 
to introduce new routes is a prudent move to bolster passenger revenues.<nl/>Zacks Rank<nl/>Alaska Air Group 
currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Better-ranked airline stocks include Virgin America VA[3] and Ryanair 
Holdings plc RYAAY[4]. Both the stocks hold a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from 
Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free

Stock futures were mildly lower and steady ahead of Tuesday's open. Dow futures traded 44.8 points below fair 
market value. 
Nasdaq 100 futures were down 14.6 points. S...00 futures backed off 7.4 points.<nl/> The stock market today[1] 
sets out with the Nasdaq and S...00 beginning to zero in on highs. The Nasdaq opens 1.9% below this year's high, 
marked on July 20. The S...00 is 1.4% from its May high. Both indexes are sitting on top of five-week rallies, their 
strongest run-ups since an October-November rally last year.<nl/> A light day of economic news[2] will include 
October car sales numbers released by automakers throughout the day. The Commerce Department reports 
September factory orders data at 10 a.m. ET.<nl/> Oil traded up less than 1%, with West Texas Intermediate 
holding above $46 a barrel. Gold slipped a fraction to just above $1,131 an ounce.<nl/> In stocks, King Digital 
Entertainment (NYSE:KING[3]), maker of the addictive Candy Crush online game, zoomed up 16% in premarket 
action. Video game heavyweight Activision-Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI[4]) agreed to buy Ireland-based King for $5.9 
billion in cash. Activision shares, which on Monday closed just below an Oct. 23 high, slipped 3%.<nl/> Big names 
in motion following earnings reports included Archer Daniels Midland (NYSE:ADM[5]) (down 4%), and Sprint 
(NYSE:S[6]) (down 8%). Tech names Fitbit (NYSE:FIT[7]) and Taser International (NASDAQ:TASR[8]) were also 
sharply lower after their quarterly results.<nl/> Discovery Communications (NASDAQ:DISCA[9]) skipped up 5% 
after reporting mixed Q3 results. Earnings topped, revenue missed analyst consensus estimates. Management[10] 
also announced a $2 billion share buyback program. The stock has been in a weakening consolidation for 14 
months.<nl/> Zoetis (NYSE:ZTS[11]) reported a healthy Q3 beat and jumped 3%. The Florida Park, N.J., company 
topped estimates on both its sales and earnings lines, and hoisted its full-year EPS guidance above expectations. 
The stock has scooped out a 32% deep consolidation, begun in June.<nl/> Among leaders, Atlanta-based payment 
processor Global Payments (NYSE:GPN[12]) jumped 5% before the bell. The stock ended Monday just below last 
week's high, and well extended above a 118.13 buy point.<nl/> Ryanair Holdings (NASDAQ:RYAAY[13]) picked up 
a 2% premarket gain. The Ireland-based economy[14] airline is in a flat base with an 82.81 buy point.<nl/> 
Overseas markets were mixed, with Japan the morning's standout. Tokyo's Nikkei 225 dropped 2.1%, dragging 
down by iron and steel stocks tumbling after weak manufacturing data from China.<nl/> [ 1]:

Here's a super quick guide to what traders are talking about right now (SPY, SPX, DJI, IXIC, DAX , FTSE, 
CNY, USD, TLT, TLX, JPY, EUR)
Here's a super quick guide to what traders are talking about right now (SPY, 
SPX, DJI, IXIC, DAX, FTSE, CNY, USD, TLT, TLX, JPY, EUR)
The Business Insider
November 2, 2015 Monday 1:50 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 648 words
Byline: aoyedele@businessinsider.com,  (Akin Oyedele) Akin Oyedele
Body
Nov 02, 2015( The Business Insider: http://www.businessinsider.com/ Delivered by Newstex) ;<nl/> Thomson 
Reuters<nl/>Via Dave Lutz at JonesTrading, here's a super quick guide to what traders are talking about before 
markets open on Monday:<nl/>
 Good Morning and welcome to Jobs Week! US Futures are starting mixed this AM, continuing a theme which sees 
S...p small but the Russell lagging. European markets are mostly green, led by a 90bp pop in the DAX with EU 
Banks leading as Commerzbank returns to paying a divvy and Greek Stress Test results not as bad as feared. 
Another Strong airline report being met with sharp selling as Ryanair drops 4%+, and Miners weigh on FTSE, with 
Glencore and BHP under pressure as China PMI comes in light - pushing London down 40bp in light Volume. The 
standout market in Europe is Turkey, which sees markets up 5%+ as Erdogan's party sweeps back to power with a 
surprise win. Over in Asia, it was a sea of red thanks to weaker China data, hitting Shanghai for 1.7% - while Nikkei 
fell 2% as investors reacted toFriday's BOJ - Financials and utilities weighed heavy (Japan closed for Culture Day 
tomorrow). Aussie fell 1.4% as grocers continue to reel from Woolworths last week - while most Emerging Markets 
closed mixed. <nl/> The US 10YY has shot back to test Friday's highs near 2.17% and the 'Policy Sensitive' 2YY is 
climbing to 75bp and December Fed Funds show a 'Coin Flip' as we await a slew of Fed Speakers this week, 
including Janet on Wednesday. The Greenback is mixed, as the Pound jumping on strong British PMI - and $ losing 
slight ground against the Euro as Nowonty says the 'ECB has to act' - but making gains against the Yen as the $/Y 
cross rebounds from the 120 level. With the weaker $, we should hava tailwind for commodities, but most metals 
are firmly red as Industrial exposed Platinum and Silver drop 1%+, and the Crude complex is off 1.5%+ on weaker 
China data. Natty Gas is continuing its downward trajectory as heavy stockpiles coupled with mild weather have 
heavy selling continuing in the complex - knocking contracts off 3%+ early. <nl/> Ahead of us today, we get Markit

Stocks Rally To Session Highs; Fitbit, Tesla Jump
Stocks Rally To Session Highs; Fitbit, Tesla Jump
Stock Market Today
November 2, 2015 Monday 8:34 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 556 words
Body
Nov 02, 2015( Stock Market Today: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> 
Stocks extended their gains, boosting the major indexes to session highs heading into the last hour of the regular 
trading session. The Nasdaq rallied 1.3%, the S...00 rose 0.9%, and the Dow Jones industrial average was up 
0.7%. Volume was tracking slightly lower across the board vs. 
the same time Friday.<nl/> Computer hardware, biotechs and automakers were among the top gainers in the stock 
market today[1], while retail and apparel makers' stocks lagged.<nl/> IBD 50[2] stocks Celgene 
(NASDAQ:CELG[3]) and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:REGN[4]) gained 4% and 3%, respectively. 
Celgene is shaping the right side of a consolidation with a 140.82 buy point. The biotech, which reports Thursday 
before the open, said Friday that European officials approved Vidaza for the treatment of some patients ages 65 
and up with acute myeloid leukemia.<nl/> Regeneron is in the 5% buy zone from a 557.97 double-bottom entry 
cleared Oct. 27. Also on Friday, the biotech said its Bayer HealthCare unit won European approval for Eylea to treat 
visual impairment due to myopic choroidal neovascularization. Regeneron reports Wednesday before the 
open.<nl/> Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA[5]) cruised 4% higher in above-average volume ahead of its Q3 
earnings[6] due Tuesday after the close. Analysts expect the electric-car maker to post a 50-cent loss on a 35% 
sales jump to $1.26 billion. Shares are still well below their 50-day and 200-day lines.<nl/> Fitbit (NYSE:FIT[7]) 
jumped 3% in fast-paced turnover ahead of its quarterly report after the close. It soared 8% Friday on a bullish 
analyst report. The fitness-tracking device maker is expected to earn 10 cents a share on $351 million in sales. The 
expected revenue gain[8] is 130%.<nl/> Ryanair Holdings (NASDAQ:RYAAY[9]) gapped up and rose 3% in fast 
trade as it shapes a flat base with an 82.81 buy point. The Irish discount airline reported fiscal Q2 profit and sales 
that topped views and said it expects full-year earnings at the upper end of its forecast.<nl/> Among other carriers 
up in volume, JetBlue Airways (NASDAQ:JBLU[10]) lifted 4%, and Virgin America (NASDAQ:VA[11]) 3%.<nl/> 
Follow Nancy Gondo on Twitter @IBD_NGondo[12].<nl/> [ 1]: http://www.investors.com/stock-market-today [ 2]:

Dude finds his exact doppelgänger in his airplane seat
Dude finds his exact doppelgänger in his airplane seat
The Daily Dot
October 30, 2015 Friday 11:14 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 356 words
Byline: Josh Katzowitz
Body
Oct 30, 2015( The Daily Dot: http://www.dailydot.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Who among us hasn't wanted to 
meet their doppelgänger—either by chance on the street or while checking out produce in the grocery store or while 
eating Sunday morning brunch and trying to fight off a hangover?
<nl/>Or, in the case of the ginger gentlemen below, on a plane. These two dudes who look exactly the same but 
aren't related were traveling to the same place at the same time, and they didn't even have to spend a month online 
trying to find the other[1]. Check out how well they mirror the other.<nl/> Lee Beattie told BuzzFeed[2] that Neil 
Thomas Douglas, the man on the right, is a photographer who was flying from Glasgow to Galway in order to shoot 
a wedding.<nl/> 'When he got on his Ryanair flight, there was a dude already on his seat," Beattie said. 'He asked 
him to move, and when the guy looked up, he thought: 'Holy shit, he looks like me.' They had a big laugh about it—
everyone around them had a laugh, they took a selfie and that was it.'<nl/>They also happened to check into the 
same hotel, and later that night, they ended up in the same pub. So they drank a pint in solidarity, celebrating how 
their lives temporarily joined together (and how they're now joined together forever on the Internet). <nl/> And then 
the freakin' floodgates opened.<nl/><nl/>All of which serves as a reminder: Your mother might have told you as a 
child that you were special. And maybe that's true. But if you're a dude with a big red beard and short, light hair 
that's expertly styled, your mother quite possibly has lied to you.<nl/> Photo via Lee Beattie[3]/Twitter<nl/> Related 
stories from The Daily DotDude finds his exact doppelgänger in his airplane seat[4]<nl/> [ 1]: 
http://www.dailydot.com/lol/finding-your-doppelganger-online/ [ 2]:            http://www.buzzfeed.com/alanwhite/a-guy-
with-a-beard-met-his-doppelganger-on-a-plane-and-thing?bffbnews..._term=.ynWVm0P1J5#.tpzwbR4B3V [ 3]:            
https://twitter.com/leebeattie/status/660005167337730048 [ 4]:            http://www.dailydot.com/lol/doppelgangers-
meet-on-plane-share-pints/

Man Meets His Exact Lookalike On A Flight, Takes The Best Selfie
Man Meets His Exact Lookalike On A Flight, Takes The Best Selfie
The Huffington Post
October 30, 2015 Friday 4:05 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 665 words
Byline: Suzy Strutner
Body
Oct 30, 2015( The Huffington Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/ Delivered by Newstex) ;<nl/> Most travelers 
can't wait for their airplane seatmate to stop talking[1]. But if you found yourself seated next to your exact 
doppelganger, you'd probably never want to stop bonding. <nl/><nl/>U.K. photographer Neil Thomas Douglas[2] 
took a Ryanair flight to Galway, Ireland Thursday night on his way to photograph a wedding. 
Upon boarding, he found his near-perfect twin sitting right next to him[3]: <nl/><nl/>Guy on right is the husband of 
my 
friend 
@elrottencrotch[4]. 
Guy 
on 
left 
is 
a 
STRANGER 
he 
met 
on 
a 
flight 
last 
night! 
pic.twitter.com/kwBFOOEoMc[5] — Lee Beattie (@leebeattie) October 30, 2015[6];<nl/> <nl/><nl/>Lee Beattie, a 
friend of Douglas' wife, posted the photo on Twitter[7], where it swiftly went viral. The two men had never met 
before the flight and they're not related, she told HuffPost in an email.<nl/><nl/>"There was a dude already on 
[Douglas'] seat. He asked him to move and when the guy looked up, he thought, 'Holy shit, he looks like me.' They 
had a big laugh about it -- everyone around them had a laugh, they took a selfie and that was it," Beattie 
said. <nl/><nl/>But then things got even stranger after the flight: The men found themselves checking into the same 
hotel, and later, drinking at the same bar. <nl/><nl/>"Neil then checked into his hotel in Galway to find his 
doppelgänger checking into the same hotel ahead of him. They laughed," Beattie said. "Later that night, Neil went 
to the pub and again, there was his twin. Total weirdness. They had a laugh and a pint."<nl/><nl/>Not long after 
Beattie's post, another doppelgänger chimed in [8]on Twitter. Then another[9], and another. Three red-bearded 
men have so far claimed to resemble those on the plane: <nl/><nl/>I count five! @the_real_pumps[10] 
@ndmckeown[11] 
@Artminx[12] 
@leebeattie[13] 
@elrottencrotch[14] 
@ben_cameron[15] 
pic.twitter.com/iIIPmYXNXJ[16] — Niclas Jornée (@NJornee) October 30, 2015[17];<nl/> <nl/><nl/>And this, dear 
friends, is the magic of travel[18]. You never know whom you might meet:<nl/><nl/> <nl/><nl/>Also on 
HuffPost:<nl/>

Virgin America Q3 Earnings, Revenues Top on Low Fuel Cost
Virgin America Q3 Earnings, Revenues Top on Low Fuel Cost
Zacks Investment Research
October 30, 2015 Friday 2:00 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 630 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 30, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Virgin America's 
VA[1] third-quarter 2015 adjusted earnings of $1.64 per share beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.57 largely 
on the back of low fuel expenses.<nl/>Meanwhile, operating revenues came in at $410.9 million, surpassing the 
Zacks Consensus Estimate of $406 million and the year-ago figure by 1.3%. Passenger revenues for the period 
were $366.1 million, up a marginal 0.1% from the year-ago quarter figure. 
Other revenues were $44.8 million, reflecting 12.2% year over year growth.<nl/>During the third quarter, passenger 
revenue per available seat mile (PRASM) fell 2.7% to 11.05 cents on the back of a 100 basis point-increase in load 
factor (% of seats filled) to 82.5%. Yield per passenger mile decreased to 13.38 cents from 13.62 cents a year ago. 
Revenue per available seat mile (RASM) declined 15.9% during the reported quarter to 12.4 cents.<nl/>Capacity 
was flat year over year in the third quarter of 2015. Cost per available seat mile (excluding special items, fuel costs 
and profit sharing) rose 11% to 7.34 cents. Fuel cost per gallon (excluding special items) declined 37.7% during the 
quarter to $1.95.<nl/>Guidance<nl/>The carrier expects capacity to expand in the range of 9.5% to 10.5% in the 
fourth quarter of 2015 on a year-over-year basis. Moreover, the company projects PRASM (a measure of unit 
revenue) decrease of 3% to 5% in the fourth quarter. The carrier projects average economic fuel cost (inclusive of 
related taxes and hedge costs) in the band of $1.75 and $1.85 per gallon in the fourth quarter.<nl/>Currently, Virgin 
America sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).<nl/>Stocks to Consider<nl/>Other favorably ranked stocks in the 
same space include Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[2], SkyWest Inc. SKYW[3] and Hawaiian Holdings, Inc. HA[4]. All 
the three companies sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks 
Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report 
>>[5]<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best 
Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report[6] RYANAIR HLDGS (RYAAY): Free Stock Analysis 
Report[7] HAWAIIAN HLDGS (HA): Free Stock Analysis Report[8] SKYWEST INC (SKYW): Free Stock Analysis

Lufthansa profit soars on low fuel prices
Lufthansa profit soars on low fuel prices
Deutsche Welle Business
October 29, 2015 Thursday 11:02 AM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 267 words
Body
Oct 29, 2015( Deutsche Welle Business: http://www.dw-world.de/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> German flagship 
carrier Lufthansa has reported a surge in bottom-line earnings for the third quarter, saying the jump is also 
attributable to low oil prices. 
The company lifted its full-year outlook. Lufthansa on Thursday said its net profit for the July to September period 
increased by 41.5 percent year-on-year to 794 million euros ($867 million).<nl/> The company, which owns 
subsidiary Germanwings as well as Swiss and Austrian Airlines, saw its revenue up 5.1 percent in the same 
period.<nl/> "The realignment of the Lufthansa group is now being reflected in good results," CEO Carsten Spohr 
said in a statement. "There's no question that the low oil price helped us achieve these."<nl/> He conceded, though, 
that "we cannot expect to fly for too long with a tailwind of low oil prices."<nl/> Fierce competition in the skies<nl/> 
Lufthansa also logged an increase in passenger volumes in the summer months and a significantly improved load 
factor.<nl/> The airline said it was now projecting full-year operating profit to come in at between 1.75 and 1.95 
billion euros, up from the 1.5 billion euros projected previously.<nl/> Lufthansa is in the middle of a huge 
restructuring process aimed at becoming more profitable and keeping at bay long-haul rivals such as Emirates and 
Turkish Airlines. In Europe, the carrier is struggling with mounting competition from budget airlines such as Ryanair. 
It's aiming to boost operations of its own no-frills carrier, Eurowings.<nl/> hg/pad (AFP, Reuters, dpa)<nl/> 
Load-Date: October 29, 2015
End of Document
Lufthansa profit jumps on low fuel prices
Lufthansa profit jumps on low fuel prices
Deutsche Welle Business

Body
Oct 29, 2015( Deutsche Welle Business: http://www.dw-world.de/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> German flagship 
carrier Lufthansa has reported a surge in bottom-line earnings for the third quarter, saying the jump is also 
attributable to low oil prices. 
The company lifted its full-year outlook. Lufthansa reported Thursday its net profit for the July to September period 
increased by 41.5 percent year-on-year to 794 million euros ($867 million).<nl/> The company, which owns 
subsidiaries Germanwings as well as Swiss and Austrian Airlines, saw its revenue up 5.1 percent in the same 
period.<nl/> "The realignment of the Lufthansa group is now being reflected in good results," CEO Carsten Spohr 
said in a statement. "There's no question that the low oil price helped us to achieve these."<nl/> He conceded, 
though, that "we cannot expect to fly for too long with a tailwind of low oil prices."<nl/> Fierce competition in the 
skies<nl/> Lufthansa also logged an increase in passenger volumes in the summer months and a significantly 
improved load factor.<nl/> The airline said it was now projecting full-year operating profit to come in at between 
1.75 - 1.95 billion euros, up from the 1.5 billion euros projected previously.<nl/> Lufthansa is in the middle of a huge 
restructuring process aimed at becoming more profitable and keeping at bay long-haul rivals such as Emirates and 
Turkish Airlines. In Europe, the carrier is struggling with mounting competition from budget airlines such as Ryanair. 
It's aiming to boost operations of its own no-frills carrier, Eurowings.<nl/> hg/pad (AFP, Reuters, dpa)<nl/>

Southwest Airlines Unveils 10 New Routes, Eyes Spring Travel
Southwest Airlines Unveils 10 New Routes, Eyes Spring Travel
Zacks Investment Research
October 29, 2015 Thursday 9:05 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 628 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 29, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Dallas-based low-
cost carrier Southwest Airlines LUV[1] has been making constant efforts to expand further in a bid to boost 
revenues and improve customer satisfaction. To that end, the company has been consistently adding new 
routes.<nl/>
The latest move in that direction came when the carrier stated that it will launch ten new non-stop routes from next 
year. The fares (one-way) for the new routes have kept notably low to attract more fliers during the spring season. 
The flight schedule has been extended from April 12 through June 3.<nl/>The table below summarizes the new 
routes to be introduced by the carrier. Apart from the non-stop service connecting St. Louis and Pittsburgh, all other 
flights will start operating from Apr 12. The flights on the St. Louis - Pittsburgh route will start operating on Mar 
10.<nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/><nl/> <nl/>Tickets 
are 
already 
available for the new flights and customers must buy their tickets by Nov 2 to avail the low fares. Moreover, the 
carrier intends to offer nonstop service between St. Louis and Seattle across the year. The service was previously 
offered on a seasonal basis.<nl/>The announcement of the new routes comes close on the heels of the company 
reporting higher-than-expected earnings and revenues in the third quarter of 2015. Results were aided by low fuel 
costs. The carrier is making huge savings, thanks to low fuel costs. In such a favorable backdrop, the plan to 
introduce new routes is a prudent move to bolster passenger revenues.<nl/>Zacks Rank<nl/>Southwest Airlines 
currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). Investors interested in the airline space may also consider, Virgin America 
VA[2], Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[3] and SkyWest Inc. SKYW[4]. All the three companies sport a Zacks Rank #1 
(Strong Buy).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7

EZU, VGLT: Big ETF Inflows
EZU, VGLT: Big ETF Inflows
Market News Video
October 29, 2015 Thursday 3:49 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 171 words
Body
View Video
Oct 29, 2015 (Market News Video:http://marketnewsvideo.com/ Delivered by Newstex)
 Comparing units outstanding versus one week ago at the coverage universe of ETFs at ETF Channel, the biggest 
inflow was seen in the iShares MSCI Eurozone ETF (EZU), which added 14,500,000 units, or a 4.2% increase 
week over week. Among the largest underlying components of EZU, in morning trading today Ryanair Holdings 
(RYAAY) is off about 1.6%. 
And on a percentage change basis, the ETF with the biggest increase in inflows was the Vanguard Long-Term 
Government Bond ETF (VGLT), which added 900,000 units, for a 28.6% increase in outstanding units.

The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: FedEx , United Parcel Service , TNT Express and Ryanair Holdings
The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: FedEx, United Parcel Service, TNT 
Express and Ryanair Holdings
Zacks Investment Research
October 28, 2015 Wednesday 2:15 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1246 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 28, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> For Immediate 
Release<nl/> <nl/> Chicago, IL - October 28, 2015 - Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst 
Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the 
financial markets. 
Stocks recently featured in the blog include the FedEx Corporation (FDX[1]), United Parcel Service, Inc. (UPS[2]), 
TNT Express N.V. (TNTEY[3]) and Ryanair Holdings (RYAAY[4]). <nl/> <nl/> Today, Zacks is promoting its ''Buy'' 
stock recommendations. Get #1Stock of the Day pick for free[5].<nl/> <nl/> Here are highlights from Tuesday's 
Analyst Blog: <nl/> <nl/> FedEx Gears Up for Record Holiday Season Deliveries<nl/> <nl/> With the holiday season 
approaching, transportation/logistics stocks like FedEx Corporation (FDX[6]) and United Parcel Service, Inc. 
(UPS[7]) are fully in focus, as is the case at this time every year. The holiday season is normally considered a busy 
period for such companies, as shipping volumes tend to surge.<nl/> <nl/> Yesterday, FedEx - a leading player in 
the field of global express delivery services -unveiled a rosy forecast pertaining to the holiday season, predicting 
record shipping volumes during the period. The Memphis, TN-based shipping giant foresees 317 million shipments 
- a 12.4% year-over-year increase - during the Black Friday-to-Christmas Eve period.<nl/> <nl/> To meet the surge 
in demand, FedEx intends to add in excess of 55,000 employees to its workforce this holiday season. Package 
handlers and drivers, apart from other support functions, would primarily see a seasonal addition in workforce.<nl/> 
<nl/> Recent growth trends in e-commerce are primarily responsible for this optimistic forecast. Data released by 
the National Retail Federation has projected a 3.7% increase in retail sales in November and December to $630.5 
billion. With shopping going the digital way, e-commerce sales are expected to shine, with growth expected in the 
band of 6-8% to $105 billion.<nl/> <nl/> An additional day this holiday season, compared to last year, is the icing on 
the cake. Shipment volumes are expected to touch astronomical heights on Cyber Monday (Nov 30) and the first 
two Mondays in December. The company stated that it hopes to move more than double its daily average on these 
three consecutive super-busy Mondays.<nl/> <nl/> The holiday season forecast has been included in the 
company's earnings per share projection for fiscal 2016. Management expects earnings per share in the band of 
$10.40-$10.90 for the current fiscal.<nl/> <nl/> Furthermore, the company will expand its operations during the 
holiday season to manage the rush. The company's Ground unit will run seven-day sort operations and FedEx 
Express will run additional hub sorts, in accordance with customer needs.<nl/> <nl/> FedEx is, in fact, leaving no 
stone unturned to ensure that holiday season demand is met effectively and the 2013 experience, when both FedEx 
and UPS were caught napping, is not repeated, courtesy of a harsh winter and an unexpected surge in on-line 
The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights: FedEx , United Parcel Service , TNT Express and Ryanair Holdings
shopping. To this end, the company has stated in its press release that it is investing $1.6 billion in fiscal 2016 
primarily in capacity and automation projects at the FedEx Ground division.<nl/> <nl/> FedEx's rival UPS has 
already announced that in order to meet the expected demand surge during the holiday season, it intends to hire 
around 90,000 to 95,000 additional employees. We expect a further update on UPS' holiday season plans on its 
third quarter 2015 conference call scheduled for today.<nl/> <nl/> FedEx's bullish holiday season projection comes 
close on the heels of the removal of a major hurdle in the way of its impending acquisition of Dutch company, TNT 
Express N.V. (TNTEY[8]), for approximately $8.75 per share, or $4.8 billion. The deal is now expected to be 
completed in the first half of calendar year 2016, as scheduled originally, as the European Commission has not 
raised any objection on the deal following its thorough review of the same. In the event of the deal materializing, 
FedEx would significantly strengthen its foothold in the European market.<nl/> <nl/> Zacks Rank<nl/> <nl/> FedEx 
presently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). A better-ranked stock in the transportation space is Ryanair Holdings 
(RYAAY[9]) which sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).<nl/> <nl/> Want the latest recommendations from Zacks 
Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report
