Norwegian 's CEO just told us it's siphoning customers from its competitors with £150 tickets from London to 
the US
Norwegian's CEO just told us it's siphoning customers from its competitors 
with £150 tickets from London to the US
The Business Insider
October 28, 2015 Wednesday 5:15 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 925 words
Byline: lbrinded@businessinsider.com,  (Lianna Brinded) Lianna Brinded
Body
Oct 28, 2015( The Business Insider: http://www.businessinsider.com/ Delivered by Newstex) ;<nl/> 
Norwegian<nl/>Norwegian, Europe's third-largest budget airline, is aiming to get more business travellers on board 
by making sure its routes from London to different parts in the US are always around £149-£179 ($228-$274).<nl/>
 This is a bit of coup considering long-haul flights to these destinations usually cost at least twice that amount on 
larger incumbent airlines, and aren't available from budget rivals such as Ryanair and easyJet.<nl/> Bjorn Kjos, the 
CEO of Norwegian, told Business Insider that the airline is aiming to rapidly expand in the US and South America 
by serving regular and business travellers, offering prices that legacy airlines can't match, including a London 
Gatwick Airport to Boston flight.<nl/> "We're planning to keep expanding in the US and we are launching our low-
cost route to Boston in May next year. We can't give an exact price but it will be around the Puerto Rico level," said 
Kjos, referring to Norwegian's ownership of Britain's only direct route to Puerto Rico with fares from £179 
($274).<nl/> "We're also hoping to cover Washington DC as well as a few other places in South America and Africa. 
The latter two actually are heavily underserved and have high prices."<nl/> This month, Norwegian agreed to 
purchase 19 new Boeing 787-9 Dreamliners. This is a huge deal because the order more than quadruples its 
current long-haul fleet to 38 aircraft within the next five years.<nl/> Considering it does already have short-haul 
flights in Europe, its bid to expand long-haul routes means that it directly competes with incumbent airlines such as 
British Airways and Virgin — but at half the price. It already offers direct flights to popular destinations, such as New 
York, Los Angeles and Fort Lauderdale, with fares from just £149 ($228).<nl/> Compare this to even a quick search 
on various travel booking websites like Expedia and you can see that the cheapest flights come in at around £500 
($766) and they're indirect.<nl/> "We have a lot business people to date especially long haul because they like the 
low cost that you can't get on legacy carriers combined with the premium seating in-flight as well as features such 
as free Wi-fi — even on short-haul flights," said Kjos.<nl/> "We're looking at Asia in the future but we're 
concentrating on expanding in the US right now."<nl/> It seems to be working.<nl/> Norwegian's third quarter 
results showed a 15% rise in revenue[1], compared with the same period last year. Year-to-date, sales rose by 
15%, compared to the same period in 2014. Pre-tax profits came to 1.1 billion Norwegian krone (£87 million).<nl/> 
In the third quarter, the load factor rose by 6%, compared to the previous period, to 91%. The airline also carried 
7.7 million passengers this quarter while long-haul passenger growth expanded by 15%.<nl/> Norwegian has 
clearly found a gap in the market and its CEO Kjos highlighted how a low oil price environment is helping their 
expansion. Oil prices are around $44 per barrel at the moment. Last summer they were over triple digits. <nl/> 
Norwegian 's CEO just told us it's siphoning customers from its competitors with £150 tickets from London to 
the US
Companies that use oil or fuel usually hedge themselves by agreeing to buy a quantity of the commodity for a 
certain price by a certain date. This means a company could save money if prices were to rise. However, it could 
lose a company lots of money if prices started to crash.<nl/> "When oil was at $100 per barrel we thought there was 
as much risk of it falling as it did going up, so we hedged our fuel by less than 50%," said Kjos. "We're happy with 
that and we don't plan to up our hedging as we anticipate oil prices staying low for at least another two years."<nl/> 
So overall, it looks Norwegian is in a pretty nice sweet spot. It all screams a little like preparation to be bought out. 
However, Kjos was very quick to shoot us down when we mentioned whether they were looking for a suitor.<nl/> 
"Hey no! We've been on our own since 2002 and our idea and strategy is to serve this new market and to keep 
expanding," said Kjos. "Our plans are long term, like 40 or 50 years. We are in a great position and it's easy for us 
to compete against other airlines right now. We're not looking for anything else."<nl/>NOW WATCH: This is what 
will happen if the Fed raises rates[2]<nl/>See Also: This guy used a frequent-flyer loophole to take a $60,000 trip in 
a first-class suite on Emirates — here's what it was like[3]Disney announced all its movies coming in the next 4 
years — here's what you have to look forward to[4]Facebook will give employees super slow internet speeds every 
Tuesday 
to 
better 
understand 
markets 
like 
India[5]<nl/>

Can Virgin America ( VA ) Earnings Pull a Surprise in Q3?
Can Virgin America (VA) Earnings Pull a Surprise in Q3?
Zacks Investment Research
October 27, 2015 Tuesday 11:00 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 691 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 27, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Virgin America Inc. 
VA[1] is set to announce third-quarter 2015 financial numbers before the opening bell on Oct 29.<nl/>
In the last quarter, the company posted a 14.06% surprise. Let's see how things are shaping up for this 
announcement.<nl/>Factors at Play<nl/>Virgin America continues to benefit from route expansion, efficient 
customer service and the launch of ancillary products and services. Moreover, low fuel prices continue to boost 
profits for the company.<nl/>However, the slump in fuel prices is likely to lead to a price war among the U.S. 
carriers, thereby exerting pressure on low-cost airline operators like Virgin America and Spirit Airlines. Moreover, 
the U.S. airline industry is expanding seat capacity which will lead to lower unit revenue as well as load factor. 
Thus, to fill up seats, most carriers are offering discounted air fares, thereby leading to stiff competition which in turn 
will impact Virgin America's revenues.<nl/>Earnings Whispers<nl/>Our proven model does not conclusively show 
that Virgin America is likely to beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate this quarter. That is because a stock needs to 
have both a positive Earnings ESP[2] and a Zacks Rank #1, 2 or at least 3 for this to happen. That is not the case 
here, as you will see below:<nl/>Zacks ESP: The Most Accurate estimate and the Zacks Consensus Estimate are 
poised at $1.57. Hence, the ESP is 0.00%.<nl/>Zacks Rank: Nokia carries a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) which 
increases the predictive power of ESP. However, the company's 0.00% ESP makes surprise prediction 
difficult.<nl/>Please note that Sell-rated stocks (#4 and 5) should never be considered going into an earnings 
announcement.<nl/>Stocks to Consider<nl/>Here are some companies you may want to consider as our model 
shows these have the right combination of elements to post an earnings beat this quarter.<nl/>Ryanair Holdings plc 
RYAAY[3] has an earnings ESP of +8.41% and a Zacks Rank #1.<nl/>Canadian National Railway Company CNI[4] 
has an earnings ESP of +1.14% and a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).<nl/>SkyWest Inc. SKYW[5] has an earnings ESP of 
+4.55% and a Zacks Rank #1.<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, 
you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report >>[6]<nl/>Want the latest 
recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days.

Spirit Airlines (SAVE) Q3 Earnings: What's in Store?
Spirit Airlines (SAVE) Q3 Earnings: What's in Store?
Zacks Investment Research
October 26, 2015 Monday 5:45 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 709 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 26, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Spirit Airlines 
SAVE[1] is set to release third-quarter 2015 financial results before the opening bell on Oct 27.<nl/>In the last 
quarter, the company posted a positive 1.98% earnings surprise. 
Let's see how things are shaping up for this announcement.<nl/>Factors at Play<nl/>Spirit Airlines is well poised to 
gain from the expansion of flight services. Moreover, the company's Ultra-Low Bare Fares(TM) program coupled 
with the Frill Control(TM) service allows passengers to pay for only those services which they require. Hence, the 
launch of these services will allow the company to maintain low ticket prices.<nl/>Capacity at Spirit Airlines is 
projected to grow 30.3% in 2015 while the carrier slashed its operating margin outlook for 2015. Flight cancellations 
and below-par revenues were the primary reasons that resulted in the outlook cut. The carrier also believes that its 
top line will remain under pressure in the near term owing to pricing challenges caused by 
overcapacity.<nl/>Earnings Whispers<nl/>Our proven model does not conclusively show that Spirit Airlines is likely 
to beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate this quarter. This is because a stock needs to have both a positive Earnings 
ESP[2] and a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), 2 (Buy) or at least 3 (Hold) for this to happen. Unfortunately, this is not 
the case here as elaborated below.<nl/>Zacks ESP: Spirit Airlines has an earnings ESP of +1.54%. This is because 
the Most Accurate estimate stands at $1.32, whereas the Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged lower at 
$1.30.<nl/>Zacks Rank: Spirit Airlines has a Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell).<nl/>Note that, we caution against stocks 
with a Zacks Rank #4 or 5 (Sell-rated stocks) going into the earnings announcement, especially when the company 
is seeing negative estimate revisions.<nl/>Stocks to Consider<nl/>Here are some companies you may want to 
consider as our model shows these have the right combination of elements to post an earnings beat this 
quarter.<nl/>Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[3] has an earnings ESP of +8.41% and a Zacks Rank #1.<nl/>Canadian 
National Railway Company CNI[4] has an earnings ESP of +1.14% and a Zacks Rank #3.<nl/>SkyWest Inc. 
SKYW[5] has an earnings ESP of +4.55% and a Zacks Rank #1.<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks 
Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report

Alaska Air Group (ALK) Beats on Q3 Earnings and Revenues
Alaska Air Group (ALK) Beats on Q3 Earnings and Revenues
Zacks Investment Research
October 26, 2015 Monday 1:55 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 658 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 26, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Alaska Air Group, 
Inc. ALK[1] reported third-quarter 2015 earnings per share of $2.16, which surpassed the Zacks Consensus 
Estimate of $2.08 and also increased 47% year over year.<nl/>
 <nl/> Quarterly revenues also increased 3.4% year over year to $1,515 million and managed to beat the Zacks 
Consensus Estimate. On a year-over-year basis, Passenger revenues improved 3%.<nl/> <nl/> Operating 
Statistics<nl/> <nl/> Airline traffic, measured in revenue passenger miles, rose 7.7% year over year to 8,878 million 
in the third quarter. Capacity or available seat miles increased 7.8% to 9,278 million. Load factor (percentage of 
seats filled by passengers) was 86% compared with 86.4% recorded in the year-ago quarter. Meanwhile, 
passenger revenue per available seat mile decreased 4.8% year over year to 11.4 cents.<nl/> <nl/> Operating 
Expenses ...erating Income<nl/> <nl/> In the quarter under review, operating income surged 37% to $433 million 
from the prior-year quarter. Total operating expenses fell 6% year over year to $1,082 million owing to a drop in fuel 
prices. Fuel price (economic) stood at $1.81 per gallon, down from $3.15 in the year-ago quarter. Meanwhile, 
consolidated unit cost or cost per available seat mile, excluding fuel, grew 2.4% year over year to 7.19 cents.<nl/> 
<nl/> Liquidity<nl/> <nl/> At the end of the third quarter of 2015, Alaska Air Group had $1,258 million in cash and 
marketable securities compared with $1,217 million at the end of fiscal 2014. During the same quarter, the company 
had long-term debt of $593 million compared with $686 million at the end of 2014. At the end of the reported 
quarter, the debt-to-capitalization ratio was 20% versus 24% at the end of last year.<nl/> <nl/> Alaska Air Group 
currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).<nl/> <nl/> Other Key Picks<nl/> <nl/> Other favorably ranked stocks from 
the same industry are Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[2], SkyWest Inc. SKYW[3] and Hawaiian Holdings, Inc. HA[4]. 
All the three companies sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).<nl/><nl/> Want the latest recommendations from

EZU, YANG: Big ETF Inflows
EZU, YANG: Big ETF Inflows
Market News Video
October 21, 2015 Wednesday 3:03 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 169 words
Body
View Video
Oct 21, 2015 (Market News Video:http://marketnewsvideo.com/ Delivered by Newstex)
 Comparing units outstanding versus one week ago at the coverage universe of ETFs at ETF Channel, the biggest 
inflow was seen in the iShares MSCI Eurozone ETF (EZU), which added 20,200,000 units, or a 6.3% increase 
week over week. Among the largest underlying components of EZU, in morning trading today Ryanair Holdings 
(RYAAY) is off about 0.6%. 
And on a percentage change basis, the ETF with the biggest increase in inflows was the Daily FTSE China Bear 3x 
Shares (YANG), which added 300,000 units, for a 34.0% increase in outstanding units.

A rail postcard from Köln
A rail postcard from Köln
Jon Worth
October 20, 2015 Tuesday 8:38 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 637 words
Byline: Jon
Body
Oct 20, 2015( Jon Worth: http://www.jonworth.eu/ Delivered by Newstex)  Dear Violeta, It's only a week or so since 
I wrote the last postcard to you[1]. That one didn't receive a response - perhaps you were too busy talking to the rail 
industry, rather than thinking of passengers' needs? Anyway, today at Köln Hbf things went spectacularly wrong as 
happens so often, so I write once more. My Berlin - Köln ICE train had a technical issue at Hamm (Westfalen), 
meaning we had to be diverted via Dortmund and Essen, and ended up at Köln Messe-Deutz rather than Köln Hbf, 
and 30 minutes delayed. 
I spoke to the DB train manager in the train to ask if he could ask the control centre to hold the ICE to Brussels just 
a few minutes so we, the dozen passengers from Berlin who needed the connection, could catch it in Köln. 'The 
train will not wait, right?' were the exact words he used on the phone to the control centre. He did not even try to 
help us, the passengers. 'It's above my level to ask a train to be held,' he later told me, grumpily. A frail, elderly lady 
who spoke no German was brushed off by the train manager, and told she would just have to take the S-Bahn from 
Deutz to Hauptbahnhof like everyone else. 'How do I do that?' was her not unreasonable reply. 'Will we have the 
right to take the later Thalys?' asked another passenger? 'How am I supposed to know,' the train manager 
answered. 'You'll have to ask at Köln station.' Gee, thanks! You see, Violeta, I can tolerate all kinds of technical 
issues, and I have also had to re-plan my way around strikes, but those I understand. But the lack of a little 
customer service, or a little flexibility for passengers really rankles. Yet when we actually got to Deutz there was our 
ICE to Brussels, just not scheduled to stop there, but only at Hauptbahnhof. So through it went, slowly, without us 
on board. A little forward thinking from the staff of the railway would have allowed it to pause briefly there, and 
saved all of us hanging around for an hour awaiting the next train. Alternatively holding it literally 3 minutes at 
Hauptbahnhof would also have solved the issue. Now, Violeta, this train trip cost me €74,20, single, and that's with 
a BahnCard25. I am paying for a supposedly premium service here, but a premium customer service damned 
certainly is not what I am getting! Ryanair offers an alternative for Berlin - Brussels trips, and I booked one last 
week for €10,19. Yes. 10 Euro. For a flight. How does that make you feel, Violeta? I suspect you don't actually 
know how much your flights cost you these days as you've a minion to do the booking for you. But let me tell you, it 
makes me feel kind of dirty. Or at least the amount of CO2 I'm going to be pumping out does. But customers are 
surely going to vote with their feet; if rail is unreliable and unfriendly, then people will go for the cheaper and faster 
option. I am sure you, like the rail firms, will pay lip service to climate goals and green transport at the COP21 
meeting in Paris. The UIC will stick on a few special trains[2] and you can smile in front of them like the hypocrites 
did prior to Copenhagen[3]. And then all will return to normal - where European railways will keep defending their 
national markets, and passengers on international routes will keep losing out. Anyway, until next time, safe travels! 
A rail postcard from Köln
Jon (Note: this is the latest in the series of Rail Postcards to the Transport Commissioner - formerly Siim Kallas, 
now Violeta Bulc. The whole series can be found here[4].) [ 1]: https://jonworth.eu/a-rail-postcard-from-berlin-
suedkreuz/ [ 2]:            http://traintoparis.org/ [ 3]:            https://jonworth.eu/the-hypocrisy-of-europes-railways-
some-observations-after-a-journey-from-brussels-to-germany/ [ 4]:            https://jonworth.eu/tag/rail-postcards/ 
Load-Date: February 29, 2016
End of Document
Delta Air Lines Faces Legal Charges for Trophy Transport Ban
Delta Air Lines Faces Legal Charges for Trophy Transport Ban
Zacks Investment Research
October 19, 2015 Monday 7:00 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 682 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 19, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Atlanta, GA-based 
airline behemoth Delta Air Lines, Inc. DAL[1] is at the center of controversy pertaining to its decision earlier in the 
year to ban transportation of big game hunting trophies.<nl/>
According to various media reports, a hunter (Corey Knowlton), who shelled out $350,000 for a permit to kill an 
endangered black rhino in Namibia, and various U.S.-based hunting clubs, have sued the carrier for its decision. In 
a lawsuit filed in a Dallas federal court, the parties alleged that Delta's ban is illegal and hurts well-meaning hunters. 
According to a Reuters report, they have argued that the ban 'hurts conservation efforts and violates its global 
obligations'. The report further states that the aggrieved parties are adamant that the 'transport of the trophies is 
permitted under a strict systems of global permits and the carrier must abide by its obligations'.<nl/>Moreover, since 
Delta is the sole American carrier operating direct flights between Johannesburg and destinations in the U.S., its 
decision to ban transportation of trophies of lions, leopards, elephants, rhinoceros and buffalos as cargo on its 
planes is a big setback to hunters' efforts to bring the trophies home.<nl/>Not keen to budge from its decision, Delta 
naturally turned down Knowlton's request to transport the trophy to the U.S. from Africa. This led the hunter and the 
other associated parties to take recourse to legal action against Delta and challenge the ban in court.<nl/>We 
remind investors that Delta enforced the ban in August this year, following the furor surrounding the killing of the 
lion, Cecil, at Zimbabwe's Hwange National Park by a Minnesota-based dentist, Walter Palmer. The dentist was on 
a vacation in Zimbabwe and, according to a report appearing in Fortune, had paid a fee of $50,000 for the trophy 
hunting. According to a Reuters report, American Airlines Group AAL[2] and United Continental Holdings UAL[3] 
had also imposed bans similar to Delta in August. <nl/>Zacks Rank<nl/>Delta carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). 
Investors interested in the airline space may also consider Ryanair Holdings RYAAY[4] which sports a Zacks Rank 
#1 (Strong Buy).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can

Frontier Management Tells Me How It's a Different Kind of Ultra Low Cost Carrier
Frontier Management Tells Me How It's a Different Kind of Ultra Low Cost 
Carrier
The Cranky Flier
October 19, 2015 Monday 12:03 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1453 words
Byline: CF
Body
Oct 19, 2015( The Cranky Flier: http://www.crankyflier.com Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Though my recent trip to 
Denver was for a wedding, I had ulterior motives. I was hoping to schedule some time with Frontier's executive 
team since the airline has been doing some really interesting things lately. The team is attempting to do something 
we haven't seen in the US yet: run an ultra low cost carrier that has a great operation. 
The transition over the last year has been tough, but Frontier is now a very different airline, and one that's doing 
quite well for itself and for its customers.<nl/><nl/>The airline's headquarters building sits in a nondescript complex 
near the bend in Pena Road a few miles west of the airport. This area was nothing until the airport was built, but 
since then, hotels and chain restaurants have popped up to serve travelers.<nl/> Right in front of the door sits a 
Jeep that was just given away to a flight attendant for achieving record ancillary sales. Inside, I had quite the line-up 
waiting for me. First up was President Barry Biffle. Then it was COO Bill Meehan and Debbie Price, VP Customer 
Experience. Lastly I'd meet with Daniel Shurz, SVP Commercial and Josh Flyr, Sr Director, Network.<nl/> A Big 
House-Cleaning<nl/>Daniel is unique in the organization. He's the only senior executive who was there before 
Indigo Partners bought the then-struggling airline from Republic back in late 2013[1]. At the time, Frontier was 
nearly two years into its attempt to change into an Ultra Low Cost Carrier (ULCC)[2] but things weren't going as well 
as hoped. Republic had unloaded Frontier for a pittance. The airline wasn't running a good operation, its costs 
weren't as low as they needed to be, and customers were angry.<nl/> Indigo came in and cleaned house, bringing 
in Barry Biffle, the former right-hand man to Spirit CEO Ben Baldanza, in April 2014. In May, Frontier found a new 
CFO. In June, Bill Meehan, formerly an exec with Continental, joined as COO and brought Debbie Price with him. 
Changes went into overdrive.<nl/> At the time, Frontier faced an internal perception problem. Its previous plan to be 
a full service hub carrier didn't work, but its employees didn't know it. According to Bill, there were no regular 
operations updates, and communication was poor across the board. For Bill, the first priority was to bring 
consistency and structure. He admitted it 'was much worse than we thought it was.'<nl/> For example, the planning 
team had moved half of the airline to flights outside of Denver, many along the east coats, but maintenance was still 
being done in Denver alone. Outside of maintenance, much of the airline's services had been outsourced to 
'business partners,' but there wasn't enough attention being paid to working with those partners to operate correctly. 
Debbie came in and implemented training programs unique to each station. Business partners are now brought in 
at least twice a year.<nl/> But Frontier's problems went beyond its operation. I asked Barry how he was going to 
differentiate Frontier, and he told me to hold on. He came back with a picture he had hanging on the wall in the 
hallway. It's the airline's blueprint.<nl/><nl/>One area that needed some attention was the network. Last summer, 
Frontier Management Tells Me How It's a Different Kind of Ultra Low Cost Carrier
Frontier had 118 routes it flew less than daily. By the end of this year it will be down to 6. Why the change? Those 
routes are more costly and more difficult to run from an operational perspective. Cutting many of these routes 
helped to simplify things.<nl/> Network and operations now work together to make sure that upcoming schedules 
can be comfortably-operated, a process that wasn't previously collaborative. The result is that the airline is now 
running a schedule that allows its airplanes to see 13 hour utilization each day, including the impact of spares. And 
it is running a very good operation.<nl/> According to masFlight[3], Frontier has seen 86.7 percent of flights arrive 
within 14 minutes of schedule since September 1. The airline has also only canceled 0.2 percent of its flights. 
Those are stellar numbers which, admittedly, have come during good weather. This winter will be a good test to see 
how things hold up.<nl/> This may sound foreign to people who are used to seeing Allegiant and Spirit run poor 
operations. But look to Europe and you can see this is a model that works. Ryanair runs one of the most punctual 
airlines around.<nl/> Changing Its Product<nl/>With things coming together, the airline turned to its product offering. 
On the pricing side, it went to a fully a la carte model[4], but then it introduced 'The Works.' For a flat fee, you can 
effectively buy what would be a very good coach product (including full refundability and extra legroom seating). If 
you don't want that, you can just pay the base fare and pick and choose your add-ons.<nl/> On the aircraft, Frontier 
went toward a much more dense offering, but it did so thoughtfully. It invested in all new seats with an interesting 
feature. The middle is wider than other seats on the airplane[5]. <nl/> Up front, there are Stretch seats which have 
Economy Plus-style legroom. In the back, the regular seats are thinner and have less legroom, but that doesn't 
mean they're torture chambers. Barry noted that the airline invested in what amounted to 30 pounds of foam 
cushioning on each aircraft above what it had to do. That may not sound like a lot, but your butt will appreciate 
it.<nl/> There are also little things that may be surprising. Yes, food and drink are sold on the airplane, but cups of 
water are free. Why do that if it's going to cost the airline? Barry likens Frontier to Wal-Mart instead of K-Mart. He 
says 'treating people just a little bit better, a little more friendly… that will make the difference.'<nl/> The Big Stuff is 
Done<nl/>All of the major changes are done. Frontier now has unit costs excluding fuel below 6 cents, which is 
similar to Spirit. But that's going to continue to go down. The airline has 80 A320neos on order along with 19 A321s 
(the first of which was just delivered). The airline has mostly smaller A319s today, and some of those will be 
returned to the lessor soon. With the increase in seating capacity, unit costs will drop. Further, fleet age will 
decrease from 9 years to 4 years. A younger fleet means Frontier can ramp up utilization even further, keeping 
costs down more. <nl/> At this point, Frontier has a cost structure that opens up a lot of opportunities on routes that 
wouldn't have worked before, and it's only going to get better.<nl/> For now, Barry just wants people to know that 
Frontier is offering, as its tagline says, 'Low Fares Done Right.' That's why the airline has started a nationwide 
campaign, including letters published in newspapers explaining that Frontier is a very different airline than it 
was.<nl/> Now What?<nl/>What's next? There aren't any big structural changes left, but now it's a matter of refining 
the model. He's working on making Frontier a more family-friendly airline, and the animals on the tail are part of 
that. While Barry says that the animals are 'neutral' for adults, 'they're a positive for kids.' Frontier's going to start 
putting the animals on the inside of the window shades. It's also going to put out baseball-style cards for each of 
them, making sure kids can have fun with it as they fly.<nl/> One of the things that bugged me was the airline's lack 
of Pre Check. Barry says Frontier is looking 'pretty heavily' at it. Its reservation system doesn't support it yet, so 
there is a cost involved.<nl/> One thing that's unlikely to come soon is wifi. 'The economics just aren't here,' 
according to Barry. But a mobile app is almost ready to be released. This is going to make check-in much easier 
with mobile boarding passes.<nl/> Watching Frontier make this transition has been painful, but it appears that the 
difficult part is largely done. If it can actually continue to run a good operation and provide a product with good 
value, then it can meaningfully differentiate itself from other ultra low cost carriers. I had the chance to fly Frontier 
on my way home, and it was actually really good. I'll post that report tomorrow.<nl/> [ 1]: 
http://crankyflier.com/2013/10/03/frontier-is-finally-sold-if-the-unions-say-ok/ 
[ 
2]: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     
http://crankyflier.com/2012/01/30/frontier-charts-its-course-as-an-ultra-low-cost-carrier/ 
[ 
3]: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     
http://masflight.com/ [ 4]:            http://crankyflier.com/2014/05/05/frontiers-new-pricing-structure-looks-a-lot-like-
spirits-but-there-are-differences/ [ 5]:            http://crankyflier.com/2015/07/21/frontiers-new-seats-give-more-room-
to-the-middle-seat-and-no-room-for-your-laptop/ 
Load-Date: October 19, 2015
Frontier Management Tells Me How It's a Different Kind of Ultra Low Cost Carrier
End of Document
Southwest Airlines Unveils International Terminal at Houston
Southwest Airlines Unveils International Terminal at Houston
Zacks Investment Research
October 16, 2015 Friday 7:55 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 644 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 16, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Dallas, TX-based 
low cost carrier Southwest Airlines Co. LUV[1] has finally launched its international terminal at Houston's Hobby 
airport. 
Following the launch, the carrier has started operating international flights from the new five-gate terminal. The 
move is consistent with the company's plans to expand international operations and improve customer 
convenience.<nl/>The terminal, which cost over $140 million, had been under construction since 2013, according to 
media reports. The commencement of operations at the new terminal is in line with Southwest's aim to strengthen 
its presence in Houston. Apparently, Southwest will use four of the five gates at the new terminal.<nl/>According to 
the press release, the first flight departed to Cancun, Mexico post the opening of the international terminal. 
Moreover, the carrier intends to operate non-stop flights connecting Houston to Jamaica (Montego Bay), Costa Rica 
(San Jose and Liberia) and Belize City, apart from other destinations in Mexico (Mexico City, Puerto Vallarta and 
San Jose del Cabo/Los Cabos).<nl/>Moreover, with nonstop flights connecting Houston with San Juan (Puerto 
Rico) and Oranjestad (Aruba), the total number of routes operational between Latin America/Caribbean islands and 
Houston will be ten. Tickets for the new flights are already available. We note that Southwest Airlines commenced 
international operations in July last year.<nl/>Notably, as of now, only a small part of Southwest Airlines' revenues 
comes from international operations. The carrier is looking to boost its international revenues through increased 
operations and new routes, and is consistently working toward the same. <nl/>Zacks Rank<nl/>Southwest Airlines 
carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). Investors interested in the airline space may also consider Ryanair Holdings 
RYAAY[2], Virgin America VA[3] and SkyWest Inc. SKYW[4]. All the three stocks sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong 
Buy).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best

Marketforce Launches Its 23rd Future of Air Transport Conference in London, 30th November-1st December 
2015
Marketforce Launches Its 23rd Future of Air Transport Conference in 
London, 30th November-1st December 2015
PR.com
October 14, 2015 Wednesday 12:25 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 335 words
Body
Oct 14, 2015( PR.com: http://www.pr.com Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> London, United Kingdom, October 14, 2015 
--(PR.com[1])-- The company's extensive research and experience ensures that attendees will benefit from in-depth 
presentations with unparalleled insight and analysis. 
Hot topics to be discussed on the day include equity partnerships and the waning importance of alliances, along 
with debates on strategic issues such as why nobody wants to be a low cost of full service airline 
anymore.<nl/><nl/>Delegates will also have the opportunity to network with some of the most senior airline 
executives from around the world, including representatives from Virgin Atlantic Airways, Ryanair, Emirates Airlines 
and Air Canada.<nl/><nl/>With over 15 C-level speakers giving exclusive industry insights, and even more 
attending, this is a unique opportunity for delegates from all aspects of the aviation industry to come together and 
explore the biggest opportunities and challenges in the sector.<nl/><nl/>"Good line-up of speakers and interesting 
topics." -Alliances Revenue Business Partner, Virgin Atlantic Airways<nl/><nl/>"It was very innovative. The great 
speakers had remarkable knowlegde ...perience." -Project Co-ordinator, South African Airways<nl/><nl/>"Like an 
investment for the future, once again time well spent." -Senior Air Traffic Advisor, Swedish Civil Aviation 
Adminstration<nl/><nl/>Please visit the website for more information on the programme and speakers. For any 
queries call +44 (0)207 760 8699 or send an email at conferences@marketforce.eu.com;<nl/><nl/>#airtran15<nl/>

Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: American Woodmark , Footlocker , Lannett , Ryanair Holdings and 
Carrols
Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: American Woodmark, Footlocker, 
Lannett, Ryanair Holdings and Carrols
Zacks Investment Research
October 13, 2015 Tuesday 2:15 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1829 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 13, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> For Immediate 
Release <nl/><nl/> Chicago, IL- October 13, 2015 - Today, Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights Features: 
American Woodmark Corporation (AMWD[1]), Footlocker, Inc. (FL[2]), Lannett Company, Inc. 
(LCI[3]), Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY[4]) and Carrols Corporation ( TAST[5]). <nl/><nl/> 5 Best 'Under the Radar' 
Stocks<nl/><nl/> You don't have to own Apple's stock to be considered a "good" investor.<nl/><nl/> While big cap 
names are often popular with investors simply because investors "know" these brands, sometimes it's the 
companies that no one knows about that provide the best long-term returns.<nl/><nl/> That's why it pays to put 
together a screen for companies with solid Zacks Ranks and good fundamentals. You might be surprised at what 
comes up.<nl/><nl/> Finding Under The Radar Stocks<nl/><nl/> Zacks covers 4400 stocks. That's a big 
universe.<nl/><nl/> How do you narrow down the list to only the best stocks, especially if you're looking for 
companies that aren't always in the news?<nl/><nl/> I started with a search of Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) stocks. 
This narrowed the list down to just 224 stocks.<nl/><nl/> That's more manageable.<nl/><nl/> Zacks' Rank Buy #1 
list also includes the Zacks Style Scores for Value, Growth and Momentum.<nl/><nl/> So you can search the 224 
stocks by any of the style scores to narrow the list down even further.<nl/><nl/> I normally am a value investor, but 
today I wanted to find just the best darn companies I could with the best Zacks Rank. If those were higher priced 
growth or momentum stocks, then so be it.<nl/><nl/> Branch Out<nl/><nl/> There are great companies that are 
hidden gems. Look outside the usual box of the big name, big cap players.<nl/><nl/> These 5 stocks are virtually 
unknown, yet their fundamentals are great. They are all Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) and have Style Scores of A in 
at least one style.<nl/><nl/> Two have Zacks Style Scores in Growth of A, one is an A in Value and two have Zacks 
Style Scores in Momentum of A.<nl/><nl/> That's not too shabby.<nl/><nl/> Investors should look around. Break out 
of the comfort zone of the big, well-known names. 4 out of the 5 listed below have crushed the return of the S...00 
over the last 10 years, which included the Great Recession sell off.<nl/><nl/> Apple's not the only great stock 
investment of the last 10 years. You might be surprised at how many hidden gems are out there, if you only 
bothered to look.<nl/><nl/> 5 Best Under the Radar Stocks to Buy Now<nl/><nl/> 1. American Woodmark 
Corporation (AMWD[6])<nl/><nl/> American Woodmark makes kitchen cabinets and vanities for the remodeling and 
new home construction markets in the United States. It sells four brands: American Woodmark, Shenandoah, 
Timberlake and Waypoint. Home Depot and Lowe's sell its brands, as well as specialty kitchen and bath designers 
and distributors.<nl/><nl/> It operates 9 manufacturing facilities and 7 service centers throughout the United 
Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: American Woodmark , Footlocker , Lannett , Ryanair Holdings and 
Carrols
States.<nl/><nl/> American Woodmark is a small cap company with a market cap of $1.16 billion.<nl/><nl/> On Aug 
20, it reported its fiscal first quarter 2016 results. Sales rose 9% to $231.2 million year over year as it saw growth in 
both dealer and new construction channels in the quarter.<nl/><nl/> Expected fiscal 2016 earnings growth of 
32.4%<nl/> Forward P/E = 25<nl/><nl/> Zacks Style Score for Growth = A<nl/> Zacks Rank #1 (Strong 
Buy)<nl/><nl/> Over the last 10 years shares up 128.7%<nl/> Over the last 10 years S...00 up 74.1%<nl/><nl/> 2. 
Footlocker, Inc. (FL[7])<nl/><nl/> Foot Locker operates 3500 stores in 23 countries in North America, Europe, 
Australia and New Zealand under several well known name brands including Foot Locker, Footaction, Lady Foot 
Locker, Champs Sports, SIX:02, Runners Point and Sidestep.<nl/><nl/> It also operates web sites for all of its 
brands as well as Eastbay, which is a site for serious athletes.<nl/><nl/> Despite a market cap of nearly $10 billion, 
the company remains an afterthought to most looking to invest in the athletic apparel craze. One of its strategic 
goals is to have company sales top $10 billion. At the end of fiscal 2014, sales were $7.15 billion, so it is well on its 
way.<nl/><nl/> Expected fiscal 2015 earnings growth = 18.3%<nl/> Forward P/E = 16.8<nl/><nl/> Zacks Style 
Score for Momentum = A<nl/> Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy)<nl/><nl/> Over the last 10 years shares up 
265.4%<nl/> Over the last 10 years S...00 up 71.4%<nl/><nl/> 3. Lannett Company, Inc. (LCI[8])<nl/><nl/> 
Founded in 1942, Lannett makes generic prescription pharmaceutical products in tablet, capsule and oral liquid 
forms to customers throughout the United States in various therapeutic areas.<nl/><nl/> With a market cap of just 
$1.7 billion, it's rare to find a small cap drug company that hasn't been swallowed up by one of the larger 
companies.<nl/><nl/> On Sep 2, Lannett announced it was purchasing Kremers Urban Pharmaceuticals for $1.23 
billion. The transaction will be funded through a fully committed term loan and cash on hand.<nl/><nl/> The 
company expects it to be a transformational acquisition as it adds a highly profitable business that will diversify its 
product lines.<nl/><nl/> Kremers has 11 product applications pending at the FDA, of which 5 include Paragraph IV 
certifications. Longer term, it has growth potential with 17 product candidates in development.<nl/><nl/> Lannett 
believes the acquisition will be accretive to fiscal 2016 earnings in the mid-to-high single digits and in the 20% to 
25% range in fiscal 2017.<nl/><nl/> Expected fiscal 2016 earnings growth = 0.6% (bigger growth expected in fiscal 
2017 of 29%)<nl/> Forward P/E = 11.6<nl/><nl/> Zacks Style Score for Value = A<nl/> Zacks Rank #1 (Strong 
Buy)<nl/><nl/> Over the last 10 years shares up 838.4%<nl/> Over the last 10 years S...00 up 74.1%<nl/><nl/> 4. 
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY[9])<nl/><nl/> Ryanair is an Irish low cost airlines that flies throughout 
Europe.<nl/><nl/> With a market cap of $21 billion, it's hard to believe it's an under-the-radar stock but when 
American investors think of the airlines, they focus on the American brands such as Southwest.<nl/><nl/> Yet, in its 
fiscal 2016 first quarter, traffic jumped 16% year over year to 28 million passengers. Recently, the momentum has 
continued. In September, traffic grew 12% compared to a year ago with the load factor rising 4% to 94%.<nl/><nl/> 
90% of its fiscal 2016 fuel is hedged. It has also hedged 70% of 2017.<nl/><nl/> Ryanair has been giving back to 
shareholders. It pays a dividend, currently yielding 2.7% and has been buying back shares.<nl/><nl/> By the end of 
fiscal 2016, the airline expects to have a fleet of 340 B737-800s.<nl/><nl/> Expected fiscal 2016 earnings growth = 
-4.5% (but analysts expect EPS growth to rebound in F2017)<nl/> Forward P/E = 15.9<nl/><nl/> Zacks Style Score 
for Momentum = A<nl/> Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy)<nl/><nl/> Over the last 10 years shares up 207.8%<nl/> Over 
the last 10 years S...00 up 74.1%<nl/><nl/> 5. Carrols Corporation (TAST[10])<nl/><nl/> You may never have heard 
of this small cap restaurant company but Carrols operates 650 Burger King restaurants in 15 states.<nl/><nl/> It 
originally started operating Carrols Burger restaurants in the 1960s but in 1975, it entered into a franchise 
agreement with Burger King for the Northeast part of the United States.<nl/><nl/> The Carrols branded stores were 
phased out and its been operating Burger Kings ever since.<nl/><nl/> On Aug 4, this Burger King operator reported 
second quarter results and saw comparable store sales jump 10.3% compared to a 2% decrease the year 
before.<nl/><nl/> It has remodeled 350 of its stores in the last year and that is boosting sales. Additionally, the 
Burger King brand is hot as its marketing campaign is working to drive traffic.<nl/><nl/> Moderating commodity 
costs also helped.<nl/><nl/> Carrols raised its full year outlook, including its comparable store sales range to 5% to 
7% from 3% to 5%. This is a brand, and a company to watch, as Burger King, under its new management team, 
seems to have some of its mojo back.<nl/><nl/> Expected 2015 earnings growth = 9.7%<nl/> Forward P/E = 
N/A<nl/><nl/> Zacks Style Score for Growth = A<nl/> Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy)<nl/><nl/> Over the last 10 years 
shares are down 14.5%<nl/> Over the last 10 years S...00 up 74.1<nl/><nl/> Zacks "Profit from the Pros" e-mail 
newsletter provides highlights of the latest analysis from Zacks Equity Research. Subscribe to this free newsletter 
today[11]. Find out What is happening in the stock market today[12] on zacks.com.<nl/> Want the latest 
recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days.

JetBlue's September Traffic Gains 13.3% Y/Y, PRASM Rises
JetBlue's September Traffic Gains 13.3% Y/Y, PRASM Rises
Zacks Investment Research
October 13, 2015 Tuesday 7:25 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 629 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 13, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Long Island City, 
NY-based low cost carrier JetBlue Airways Corporation JBLU[1] revealed traffic data for the month of September. 
Important metrics such as revenue passenger miles (RPMs - a measure of air traffic), available seat miles (ASMs: 
measure of capacity) and load factor (% of seats filled by passengers) grew on a year-over-year basis during the 
month.<nl/>
The carrier generated RPMs of 3.097 billion during the month, up 13.3% on a year-over-year basis. Moreover, 
available seat miles showed year-over-year growth of 13.1% to 3.821 billion. Load factor also showed an 
improvement as air traffic growth outpaced the rise in capacity. The metric grew by 20 basis points to 81.1% in Sep 
2015. PRASM (a measure of unit revenue: passenger revenue per available seat mile) for the month also improved 
1% from Sep 2014.<nl/>Although the measures improved on a year-over-basis, the traffic report failed to find favor 
with investors. Consequently, the stock shed value in after-market trading on Oct 12. We note that the Sep 2015 
figures for traffic, capacity and load factor were lower than the corresponding figures recorded in Aug 
2015.<nl/>JetBlue also revealed that departures in Sep 2015 were 10% higher compared with the year-ago figure. 
The company registered a completion factor of 99.6%, with 80% of its flights on schedule.<nl/>For the first nine 
months of 2015, JetBlue generated RPMs of 31.156 billion (up 9.6% from the corresponding period last year) and 
ASMs of 36.632 billion (up 9.2%). Further, the load factor grew 40 basis points year over year to 85.1%.<nl/>Zacks 
Rank<nl/>JetBlue currently carries a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). Investors interested in the airline space may also 
consider Ryanair Holdings RYAAY[2], Hawaiian Holdings HA[3] and SkyWest Inc. SKYW[4]. All the three stocks 
sport the same Zacks Rank as JetBlue.<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? 
Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report >>

EZU, RUSS: Big ETF Inflows
EZU, RUSS: Big ETF Inflows
Market News Video
October 13, 2015 Tuesday 3:53 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 168 words
Body
View Video
Oct 13, 2015 (Market News Video:http://marketnewsvideo.com/ Delivered by Newstex)
 Comparing units outstanding versus one week ago at the coverage universe of ETFs at ETF Channel, the biggest 
inflow was seen in the iShares MSCI Eurozone ETF (EZU), which added 7,500,000 units, or a 2.4% increase week 
over week. Among the largest underlying components of EZU, in morning trading today Ryanair Holdings (RYAAY) 
is up about 0.1%. 
And on a percentage change basis, the ETF with the biggest increase in inflows was the Daily Russia Bear 3x 
Shares (RUSS), which added 350,000 units, for a 35.9% increase in outstanding units.

Ryanair Holdings plc Given Buy Rating at Beaufort Securities ( RYAAY )
Ryanair Holdings plc Given Buy Rating at Beaufort Securities (RYAAY)
The Legacy
October 12, 2015 Monday 4:19 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 655 words
Byline: Noah
Body
Oct 12, 2015( The Legacy: http://www.localizedusa.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/>            
http://www.lulegacy.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgBeaufort Securities reissued their buy rating on shares 
of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) in a research note issued to investors on Tuesday morning, 
MarketBeat[1] reports.<nl/>
 Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[2]) traded up 1.32% during mid-day trading on Tuesday, reaching $77.30. 
The company's stock had a trading volume of 67,975 shares. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $49.70 
and a 52-week high of $82.71. The stock has a market cap of $21.03 billion and a PE ratio of 20.72. The company 
has a 50 day moving average of $77.46 and a 200-day moving average of $71.62.<nl/> Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results[3] on Monday, July 27th. The company reported $0.99 earnings 
per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $1.03 by $0.04. Equities analysts[4] 
forecast that Ryanair Holdings plc will post $4.81 earnings per share for the current year.<nl/><nl/>A number of 
other research analysts have also recently issued reports on the company. HSBC lowered Ryanair Holdings plc 
from a buy rating to a hold rating in a report on Friday, October 2nd. Evercore ISI started coverage on Ryanair 
Holdings plc in a research note on Monday, September 28th. They issued a buy rating and a $100.00 price 
objective on the stock. Macquarie assumed coverage on Ryanair Holdings plc in a research report on Friday, 
August 14th. They issued an underperform rating on the stock. Cantor Fitzgerald downgraded Ryanair Holdings plc 
from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research report on Monday, August 10th. Finally, Zacks[5] raised Ryanair 
Holdings plc from a hold rating to a strong-buy rating and set a $84.00 target price[6] on the stock in a report on 
Wednesday, July 29th. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, six have given a hold rating, five have 
issued a buy rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the company's stock. The company presently has 
an average rating of Hold and a consensus target price of $84.67.<nl/> Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[7]) 
is a holding company for Ryanair Limited (Ryanair). Ryanair runs a reduced fare -passenger airline serving short-
haul, point to point routes between Continental Europe, the United Kingdom, Ireland and Morocco. The Business 's 
main fleet consists of Boeing 737-800 aircraft, each having 189 seats. The Organization offered over 1,600 short-
haul flights per day serving around 190 airports across Europe, and flying about 1,600 routes, with a fleet of 
approximately 315 Boeing 737-800 aircraft and six additional leased aircraft got on short term leases. Ryanair's 
fleet totaled to 308 Boeing 737-800s. Ryanair also supplies various ancillary services and participates in other tasks 
associated using its air passenger service, including non -flight scheduled services, Internet-related services, and 
the inflight sale of merchandise, food and drinks.<nl/><nl/>Receive News ...tings for Ryanair Holdings plc Daily - 
Enter your email address below to receive a concise daily summary of the latest news and analysts' ratings for 
Ryanair Holdings plc Given Buy Rating at Beaufort Securities ( RYAAY )

United Airlines September Traffic Up on New Offers Routes
United Airlines September Traffic Up on New Offers Routes
Zacks Investment Research
October 9, 2015 Friday 4:55 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 679 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 09, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> United Airlines - the 
wholly owned subsidiary of United Continental Holdings Inc. UAL[1] - reported a rise in air traffic numbers in the 
month of September. 
Measured in revenue passenger miles (RPMs), traffic stood at 16.86 billion, up 1.4% from 16.62 billion recorded a 
year ago.<nl/>Also, consolidated capacity (or available seat miles/ASMs) inched up 1.4% year over year to 20.33 
billion. Meanwhile, the load factor or percentage of seats filled by passengers remained flat at 82.9%.<nl/>At the 
end of the first nine months of 2015, United Airlines recorded RPMs of 157.9 billion (up 1% year over year) and 
ASMs of 188.7 billion (up 1.6% year over year). Load factor stood at 83.7% compared with 84.1% in September last 
year.<nl/>Recently, United Airlines took a step toward enhancing its onboard flight services by striking a deal with 
Crafthouse and Buffalo Trace to offer premium liquor to passengers.<nl/>Meanwhile, in a bid to consolidate its 
position in China, the company announced plans to initiate non-stop weekly flights between San Francisco and 
Xi'an, starting next year.<nl/>The company's significant route expansion plans, introduction of ancillary products, 
fleet revamping and customer service enhancement bode well. Further, United Airlines has been reaping 
considerable benefits from its joint ventures and code share agreements.<nl/>Meanwhile, declining oil prices will 
likely result in increased capacity, thereby leading to discounted ticket prices in order to fill up seats. A stronger U.S. 
dollar is also expected to impact revenues because of United Airlines' global presence.<nl/>On the other hand, U.S. 
airline Delta Air Lines Inc. DAL[2] recently posted a 2.4% year over year increase in air traffic in the month of 
September. The premium carrier expects unit revenue for the third quarter of 2015 to decline in the band of 4.5% 
and 5.5%.<nl/>Stocks to Consider<nl/>United Continental currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). Other favorably 
ranked stocks in the same space are Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[3] and JetBlue Airways Corp. JBLU[4]. Both the 
companies sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment 
Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report

Hawaiian Airlines ' September Traffic Up on Favorable Factors
Hawaiian Airlines' September Traffic Up on Favorable Factors
Zacks Investment Research
October 8, 2015 Thursday 5:45 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 595 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 08, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Hawaiian Airlines, 
Inc. - a subsidiary of Hawaiian Holdings, Inc. HA[1] - posted a rise in air traffic in the month of September. 
Traffic - measured in revenue passenger miles (RPMs) - came in at 1.18 billion, up 2.3% from 1.16 billion recorded 
a year ago.<nl/>On a year-over-year basis, consolidated capacity (or available seat miles/ASMs) inched up 2.8% to 
1.44 billion. However, the load factor or percentage of seats filled by passengers decreased to 82.1% from 82.5% in 
Sep 2014.<nl/>In the first nine months of 2015, Hawaiian Airlines generated RPMs of 10.82 billion (up 4% from the 
corresponding period last year) and ASMs of 13.33 billion (up 4.1%). Meanwhile, load factor increased 10 basis 
points year over year to 81.2%.<nl/>Increased travel demand and continuous route expansion are the primary 
factors which drove the upside in air traffic. These positives are expected to boost the carrier's performance in the 
future as well.<nl/>Hawaiian Airlines expects operating revenue per ASM to decline between 4.5% and 5.5% year 
over year in third-quarter 2015. Furthermore, the carrier expects fuel price to decrease to $1.93 to $1.98 per gallon 
from the previous guidance of $2.00-$2. Unit cost per ASM (Excluding fuel) is expected to fall in the range of 1.5% 
to 2.5%, wider than the earlier guidance of a 2.5% to 5.5% decline.<nl/> Stocks to Consider<nl/>Hawaiian Holdings 
currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). Other favorably ranked stocks in the same space are JetBlue Airways 
Corp. JBLU[2], Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[3] and Delta Air Lines DAL[4]. All the three companies sport a Zacks 
Rank #1 (Strong Buy).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can 
download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report >>[5]<nl/>Want the latest 
recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days.

Belgium Consumer Market: New insights
Belgium Consumer Market: New insights
CompaniesandMarkets.com
October 7, 2015 Wednesday 4:39 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 236 words
Body
Oct 07, 2015( CompaniesandMarkets.com: http://www.companiesandmarkets.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> 
The Belgian outbound market recorded 5.2% growth in 2014, increasing from 10.7 million trips in 2013 to 11.1 
million trips. Outbound trips are important to Belgians, even in tough economic times. With only 2.7 million domestic 
trips made in 2014, Belgians prefer outbound journeys over domestic trips. As a result, outbound expenditure has 
been growing in the last few years<nl/>Ryanair opened its second Belgian base at Brussels Zaventem airport in 
2014 and is also the market leader in Belgium. Meanwhile, Antwerp Airport and Oostende Airport (both based in 
Flanders) have both witnessed fast growth in terms of passengers by opening up new routes<nl/>Close to 31% of 
all outbound trips were to France in 2014, which remains by far the most popular holiday destination for Belgians. 
The Netherlands as an outbound destination has also seen rapid growth in the last few years, although the average 
Belgian tourist only spent 2.6 nights in the Netherlands in 2013<nl/><nl/>For more information on the "Source 
Market Insights; Belgium" market analysis, see the latest research: Source Market Insights; Belgium[1]<nl/>Follow 
us on Twitter @CandMResearch<nl/> [ 1]: 
http://www.companiesandmarkets.com/Market/Travel/Market-Research/Source-Market-Insights-
Belgium/RPT1328004?aCode=c64cd82a-b5ae-48fb-9757-eca787e7a8bf

JetBlue to Introduce Multiple Flights from Nashville Next Year
JetBlue to Introduce Multiple Flights from Nashville Next Year
Zacks Investment Research
October 7, 2015 Wednesday 5:00 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 658 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 07, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> In line with its route 
expansion initiatives, low-cost carrier JetBlue Airways Corp. JBLU[1] plans to flag off two daily non-stop roundtrip 
flights connecting Nashville International Airport (BNA) and Boston Logan International Airport (BOS). The company 
also intends to run a daily non-stop roundtrip flight between BNA and Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International 
Airport (FLL).<nl/>
JetBlue will initiate operations between BOS and FLL from May 5, 2016. An introductory fare of $59 for a one-way 
flight is presently on offer for customers traveling between BNA and BOS. Likewise, a one-way trip between BNA 
and FLL will cost a reasonable $79.<nl/>JetBlue will fly the Airbus 320 aircraft on the routes from and to Nashville. 
Theses planes offer better leg space and comfortable leather seats. Moreover, to enhance the in-flight experience, 
passengers will be offered complimentary snacks and other refreshments along with free access to DIRECTV 
channels and Sirius XM Holdings Inc.'s SIRI[2] satellite radio service.<nl/>Both Boston and Fort Lauderdale have 
become important tourist spots. Thus, to consolidate its position in these busy areas, JetBlue plans to flag off more 
than 130 daily flights from Boston. Moreover, to boost its Florida network, JetBlue has decided to run 95 daily flights 
from FLL during winter. Furthermore, the company's South Florida operations serve as an important hub for the 
connecting flights which take off to Latin American cities. Thus, the increased number of connecting flights from the 
region will certainly benefit passengers traveling to Latin America and Caribbean cities.<nl/>Hence, we believe that 
improved flight connectivity coupled with low fares will enhance traveling options for passengers, in turn boosting 
revenues for JetBlue.<nl/>JetBlue currently sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). Other favorably ranked stocks in 
the same space are Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[3] and Delta Air Lines DAL[4], both sporting the same Zacks 
Rank as JetBlue.<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can 
download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report >>[5]<nl/>Want the latest

Not always the cheapest train in France , and a sneaky 50 cent Belgian charge
Not always the cheapest train in France, and a sneaky 50 cent Belgian 
charge
Jon Worth
October 7, 2015 Wednesday 5:33 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 525 words
Byline: Jon
Body
Oct 07, 2015( Jon Worth: http://www.jonworth.eu/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> A couple of weeks ago Seat61 had 
the splash that booking cross-border France-Spain TGVs would cost you more on French language websites than 
anywhere else (Seat61's news page here[1] - you have to scroll down as he has no link to individual stories). After a 
bit of a furore that caused, SNCF has changed its practice and now the prices for these trains are the same 
regardless of where you book them. It was an error[2] they told Gizmodo - not sure I believe that, but anyway, that 
problem is no more.<nl/> So while that's progress, it's not all plain sailing in French rail booking. SNCF offers 
essentially three classes of TGVs - regular ones, iDTGV[3] that's like a regular TGV but you have to book online, 
and Ouigo[4], like a kind of Ryanair-TGV that has it's own garish paint scheme and interior and leaves from a 
station in the Paris suburbs.<nl/> Say then you want to book Paris - Perpignan, served by regular TGVs and 
iDTGVs. This is what you get from Captain Train (see 1007 departure):<nl/>            https://jonworth.eu/wp-
content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-Shot-2015-10-07-at-18.04.08.png<nl/> And this from Loco2 - 1007 train, but only 
at the more expensive price:<nl/>
 https://jonworth.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-Shot-2015-10-07-at-18.04.18.png<nl/> 
And 
this 
from 
SNCB Europe - same as Loco2, no iDTGV in sight:<nl/>            https://jonworth.eu/wp-
content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-Shot-2015-10-07-at-18.13.47.png<nl/> <nl/> Or try Marne la Vallée to Montpellier, 
served by regular TGVs and Ouigo. Once more Captain Train - see the 1107 departure:<nl/>            
https://jonworth.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-Shot-2015-10-07-at-18.06.47.png<nl/> And this from Loco2 
- no Ouigo (the 1107 train is not even shown):<nl/>            https://jonworth.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-
Shot-2015-10-07-at-18.06.40.png<nl/> And this from SNCB Europe - again no Ouigo:<nl/>            
https://jonworth.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-Shot-2015-10-07-at-18.12.24.png<nl/> I'd love to know 
what's going on here. Is it that these external agents have not asked for access to the iDTGV and Ouigo data? That 
SNCF will not give this data to companies outside France? Or maybe SNCB considers itself a premium service, but 
I'm pretty sure that Loco2 would aim to sell the cheapest tickets it can as its primary pitch is to tourists.<nl/> Also 
another trick I've just encountered is courtesy of SNCB Europe. Seat reservations on German trains run by DB 
normally cost €4,50. Book a DB train via SNCB's website and it's €5. Thanks, SNCB!<nl/>            
https://jonworth.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-Shot-2015-10-07-at-17.21.51.png 
 
 
 
 
 
 
     
https://jonworth.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/Screen-Shot-2015-10-07-at-17.21.58.png<nl/> [ 1]:

Europe's biggest airline is attacking Google over its 'misleading' search ads (RYA, GOOG, GOOGL)
Europe's biggest airline is attacking Google over its 'misleading' search ads 
(RYA, GOOG, GOOGL)
The Business Insider
October 6, 2015 Tuesday 9:50 AM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 707 words
Byline: loreilly@businessinsider.com,  (Lara OReilly) Lara OReilly
Body
Oct 06, 2015( The Business Insider: http://www.businessinsider.com/ Delivered by Newstex) ;;;<nl/> Ryanair, 
Europe's biggest airline, is attacking Google for its "misleading" search ads and is calling on the search giant to 
enforce advertising transparency."<nl/> In a press release[1], Ryanair points to a search for "Ryanair," which 
returns an ad from what appears to be the official airline itself. <nl/>
<nl/>In fact, Ryanair says this ad is from an unaffiliated "screenscraper" website called eDreams, which is 
"masquerading" as Ryanair and "unlawfully" selling its flights.<nl/> Here's the eDreams site the search ad redirects 
to:<nl/><nl/>Ryanair says sites such as eDreams have caused considerable problems for its customers, including 
failing or refusing to pass on information to the airline and passengers regarding details such as flight time changes, 
check-in information, special needs assistance, and contact information, which has resulted in missed flights in 
some cases.<nl/> Ryanair says it has taken legal action against several screenscraper websites across Europe. 
The Court of Hamburg ruled in January that eDreams had been using an unlawful subdomain[2] and was 
misleading customers into thinking it had an official partnership with Ryanair.<nl/> But Ryanair is demanding 
Google works harder to prevent these issues from occurring in the first place.<nl/> Tweet Embed: 
https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/651299658581549056 Dear @google[3], please make your advertising more 
transparent 
to 
stop 
consumers 
being 
misled 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
http://t.co/8BZZZkE2UT[4] 
pic.twitter.com/V5pNqXSXmF[5];<nl/> In the press release, Ryanair chief marketing officer Kenny Jacobs, says the 
company doesn't have a problem with Google advertising in general, but adds that it is "unfair" that it is sometimes 
used as a way to mislead customers.<nl/> He adds: "Ryanair will continue to pursue screenscraper websites such 
as eDreams to prevent Europe's consumers from being misled over price and booking conditions. We would again 
urge customers to book directly on the Ryanair.com website to guarantee the lowest fares and best customer 
service. In the meantime, we call on Google to enforce greater transparency of its advertising to prevent any more 
customers from being misled and overcharged."<nl/> Business Insider has contacted Google for comment, and 
we'll update this article once we hear back.<nl/> We have also contacted the UK's Advertising Standards Authority, 
to check whether Ryanair has made an official complaint.<nl/>NOW WATCH: Subliminal sex messages hidden in 
ads for wholesome brands[6]<nl/>See Also: Hunter escapes attack by shoving arm down bear's throat[7]A visibly 
angry Hillary Clinton just went off on Republicans for their Benghazi investigation[8]These are the 10 most valuable 
brands in the world[9] SEE ALSO: Goldman Sachs: Online advertising is about to be 'fundamentally restructured' by 
Apple, Google, and Facebook[10]<nl/> [ 1]:            http://corporate.ryanair.com/news/news/151006-ryanair-calls-on-
google-to-enforce-advertising-transparency-prohibit-misleading-practices/?market=ie

(RYAAY) is a Great Choice

Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 06, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Many investors like 
to look for momentum in stocks, but this can be very tough to define. There is great debate regarding which metrics 
are the best to focus on in this regard, and which are not really quality indicators of future performance. 
Fortunately, with our new style score system[1] we have identified the key statistics to pay close attention to and 
thus which stocks might be the best for momentum investors in the near term.<nl/>This method discovered several 
great candidates for momentum-oriented investors, but today let's focus in on Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[2] as 
this stock is looking especially impressive right now. And while there are numerous ways in which this company 
could be a great choice, we have highlighted three of the most vital reasons for RYAAY's status as a solid 
momentum stock below:<nl/>Longer Term Price Change for Ryanair Holdings<nl/>While any stock can see a spike 
in price, it takes a real winner to consistently outperform the market. That is why looking at longer term price 
metrics—such as performance over the past three months or year-- and comparing these to an industry at large can 
be very useful.<nl/>And in the case of RYAAY, the results are quite impressive. The company has beaten out the 
industry at large over the past 12 weeks by a margin of 9.5% to -1.5% while it has also outperformed when looking 
at the past year, putting up a gain of 40.3%. Clearly, RYAAY is riding a bit of a hot streak and is worth a closer look 
by investors. <nl/>Quarter EPS Estimate Change for Ryanair Holdings Stock<nl/>While looking at price 
performance or full year earnings can be essential to understanding a momentum stock, you shouldn't forget about 
the current quarter EPS and the trend in estimates there. This change can signal how a stock might perform in the 
next earnings season which is obviously vital for momentum investors. Right now, RYAAY is seeing a nice trend 
over the past month when it comes to this quarter's earnings estimate projections. In the time frame, EPS estimates 
for Ryanair Holdings have gone up by 93.3% compared to an industry average move of 0.4%, suggesting that not 
only is RYAAY heading in the right direction, but it is seeing an increase relative to the industry too.<nl/>RYAAY 
Earnings Estimate Revisions Moving in the Right Direction<nl/>While the great momentum factors outlined in the 
preceding paragraphs might be enough for some investors, we should also take into account broad earnings 
estimate revision trends. A nice path here can really help to show us a promising stock, and we have actually been 
seeing that with RYAAY as of late too. Over the past two months, 4 earnings estimates have gone higher compared 
to none lower for the full year, while 3 earnings estimates have gone higher compared to none lower for the next 
year time frame too. These revisions have helped to boost the consensus estimate as two months ago RYAAY was 
expected to post earnings of $3.99 per share for the full year, though today it looks to have EPS of $4.81 for the full 
year now, representing a solid increase which is something that should definitely be welcomed news to would-be 
Looking for a Top Momentum Stock? 3 Reasons Why Ryanair Holdings ( RYAAY ) is a Great Choice
investors.<nl/>Bottom Line<nl/>Given these factors, investors shouldn't be surprised to note that we have RYAAY 
as a security with a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) and a Momentum Score of 'A'. So if you are looking for a fresh pick 
that has potential to move in the right direction, definitely keep RYAAY on your short list as this looks be a stock 
that is very well-positioned to soar in the near term.<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment

The 10 things in advertising you need to know today (GOOG, GOOGL, RYA, TWTR, APP)
The 10 things in advertising you need to know today (GOOG, GOOGL, RYA, 
TWTR, APP)
The Business Insider
October 6, 2015 Tuesday 11:00 AM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 769 words
Byline: loreilly@businessinsider.com,  (Lara OReilly) Lara OReilly
Body
Oct 06, 2015( The Business Insider: http://www.businessinsider.com/ Delivered by Newstex) ;<nl/> Albert 
Gea/Reuters<nl/>Good morning. Here's everything you need to know in the world of advertising today.<nl/>
 1. Europe's biggest airline is calling on Google to prevent "misleading" search ads.[1] Ryanair claims "sitescraper" 
websites are masquerading as its brand by using a Ryanair subdomain, and unlawfully selling flights on its behalf to 
confused consumers.<nl/> 2. These are the 10 most valuable brands in the world.[2] Apple tops the list again this 
year in Interbrand's annual rankings.<nl/> 3. Twitter confirmed it has appointed Jack Dorsey as its CEO.[3] Adam 
Bain, Twitter's president of global revenue, has been promoted to COO.<nl/> 4. Jack Dorsey is the best (and 
maybe only) choice for Twitter CEO.[4] Twitter needs both a product-oriented CEO and an insider — he ticks both 
those boxes.<nl/> 5. The Daily Mail's US chief executive Jon Steinberg is leaving the company at the end of the 
year, The Wall Street Journal reports.[5] It's not yet known where he's off to next.<nl/> 6. These are the news sites 
that use up the most data when you load them up on your phone.[6] Boston.com is the worst culprit, according to a 
New York Times test of the top 50 news site home pages.<nl/> 7. These are the worst retail Photoshop disasters of 
all time.[7] From missing limbs, to bizarre thigh gaps.<nl/> 8. Emirates airlines is betting $20 million on Jennifer 
Aniston to help sell more flights.[8] It has launched a global advertising campaign, created by ad agency 
RKCR/Y#38;R.<nl/> 9. American Apparel made one huge mistake that led to its downfall.[9] The brand toned down 
its marketing.<nl/> 10. Europe's highest court rejected the "safe harbor" agreement used by American tech 
companies.[10] It's the transatlantic agreement that lets American companies use a single standard for consumer 
privacy and data storage in both the US and Europe.<nl/>NOW WATCH: See if you can spot the subliminal

Air France Plans 2,900 Job Cuts, Unions Threaten Strike
Air France Plans 2,900 Job Cuts, Unions Threaten Strike
Zacks Investment Research
October 6, 2015 Tuesday 7:25 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 836 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 06, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Employee-related 
concerns continue to trouble France's leading carrier Air France-KLM SA AFLYY[1]. As per a recent Bloomberg 
report, management at the company has been recently in talks with the union representatives over the 
retrenchment of 2,900 workers. This proposal has launched a series of protests.<nl/>
Since 1993, Air France has avoided outright firing of employees and has instead followed voluntary retirement 
schemes to cut jobs. However, after failed talks with pilots last week, Air France executives announced that 300 
cockpit crew, 900 flight attendants and 1,700 ground staff could be dismissed soon. Over the last three years, the 
company has cut back 9,000 positions.<nl/>Air France is struggling to brave global competition for short as well as 
long flights from cheap European and Middle East carriers. Moreover, budget European airlines like Ryanair 
Holdings plc RYAAY[2] and Norwegian Air Shuttle continue to gain customers owing to low fares and expanded 
networks, posing serious threat to large carriers like Air France and Deutsche Lufthansa Aktiengesellschaft 
DLAKY[3].<nl/>Air France ended its second-quarter 2015 with €4.6 billion of net debts while employee salary 
related costs stood at €1.96 billion, up 2.6% year over year. Meanwhile, the loss figure widened from the year-
earlier quarter to €70 million. Thus, to counter such negatives, the company plans to slash unit costs in the range of 
1% to 3% and also reduce debts. Moreover, immediate deployment of cost-saving measures coupled with of the 
adoption of cost-reduction techniques will benefit the company.<nl/>At the end of the second quarter of 2015, Air 
France reported a 3%year-over-year increase in revenues while load factor inched up 0.2%. Moreover, unit revenue 
per Available Seat Kilometer and unit revenue per Revenue Passenger Kilometer rose on an annual basis of 2.2% 
and 1.9%, respectively.<nl/>As a part of its cost-cutting goals, Air France is planning to shut down five long-haul 
networks and dispose 14 of its larger, long distance aircraft.<nl/>In Mar 2015, pilots of Lufthansa went on a four-day 
strike following the fallout of talks with management over early retirement benefits. Furthermore, the carrier's plan to 
expand low-cost offerings has also come under attack from the pilots.<nl/>As per a Bloomberg report, U.S. airline 
giant Delta Air Lines DAL[4] intends to trim its 'office workforce' across the globe in an attempt to boost productivity. 
The retrenchment will apparently affect management and salaried employees.<nl/>Employee-related problems 
continue to haunt the overall airline industry. It has not only hurt the airline profitability but also disrupted flight 
services. 
Moreover, 
falling 
crude 
oil 
prices 
have 
encouraged 
employees 
to 
bargain 
for 
higher 
wages.<nl/>Meanwhile, the ongoing dispute with pilots has already resulted in massive flight cancellations for Air 
France. However, implementation of aggressive strategies has improved results in the second quarter of 
2015.<nl/>Air France currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks 
Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report

Alaska Air Group September Traffic Up on Route Expansion
Alaska Air Group September Traffic Up on Route Expansion
Zacks Investment Research
October 5, 2015 Monday 4:55 PM EST
Copyright 2015 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 614 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Oct 05, 2015( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex) <nl/> Alaska Air Group, 
Inc.'s ALK[1] air traffic - measured in revenue passenger miles (RPMs) - for Sep 2015 stood at 2.63 billion, up 10% 
from 2.39 billion a year ago.<nl/>On a year-over-year basis, consolidated capacity (or available seat miles/ASMs) 
improved 10.3% to 3.22 billion. 
Meanwhile, the load factor or percentage of seats filled by passengers decreased to 81.6% from 81.9% in Sep 
2014.<nl/>At the end of the first nine months of 2015, Alaska Air Group generated RPMs of 25.05 billion (up 8.6% 
year over year) and ASMs of 29.57 billion (up 9.9% year over year). Load factor stood at 84.7% compared with 
85.7% a year ago.<nl/>A few days back, Alaska Airlines, a division of Alaska Air Group, initiated flight service 
between the cities of Seattle and Raleigh/Durham, North Carolina. This year, the carrier has added extended its 
network to six new cities (inclusive of the latest addition of Raleigh). Also, last month, Alaska Airlines flagged off 
non-stop flights between Nashville and Seattle, thereby expanding its non-stop service to 84 destinations from 
Seattle alone.<nl/>At present, Alaska Air Group serves more than 100 cities in North America. We believe that 
increased demand for air travel coupled with continuous expansion of routes and enhanced customer satisfaction 
have led to the impressive operating results. Moreover, the upcoming holiday season is likely to boost travel 
demand for the overall airlines industry.<nl/>Zacks Rank ...y Picks<nl/>Alaska Air Group currently sports a Zacks 
Rank #1 (Strong Buy). Other favorably ranked stocks in the same space are Ryanair Holdings plc RYAAY[2], Delta 
Air Lines DAL[3] and JetBlue Airways Corp. JBLU[4]. All three stocks sport the same Zacks Rank as Alaska Air 
Group.<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today, you can download 7 Best 
Stocks for the Next 30 Days. Click to get this free report >>[5]<nl/>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks
